post_text:
🏡The beautiful girl Lucy❤️ is urgently looking for a home and family🏡.  Take a closer look, maybe she is your dog.😇😇😇🥰
 She has a difficult fate and has had no luck finding a family for 9 months now.😥 She was born on the street in Pattaya between two packs of dogs, she was chased and bitten by adult dogs, she lived in fear every day.  People also hurt her, they kicked her and threw stones at her.  For a long time I tried to find her a home so that she would be safe, but no one responded, no one liked her and no one wanted to give her a home.  😔 Then she became very seriously ill, she could not walk, did not eat, was on the verge of life and death, and we took her to the clinic, where she was prescribed a lot of medications.  We moved to Phuket and took her with us, where we treated her and fought for her life, finally she fully recovered, she began to trust us, but the fear of other people and dogs remained.  She has all her vaccinations, her veterinarian's passport, she is spayed, we give anti-parasite medication every month, she has a microchip and a large dog carrier for travel.  She was supposed to fly to a new home on April 26, but at the last moment people refused and now she is looking for a home again.  She is 1 year and 3 months old, weighs 15 kg, medium size.  She is a kind girl, loves to play with toys, loves to run around the yard, loves to play with water.  She had no childhood, only fear, she did not live, but survived, and now she deserves a wonderful life in a loving family and finally find her forever home.❤️🏡😇

comments.comment: Obviously she's now bonded to you for life, so giving her to someone else is just going to be cruel!

subcomments.subcomment: If we had the opportunity to leave it, we would have left it.  We took her in for treatment because she would have died on the street, but we knew that we couldn’t keep her.  That's why we have her until she finds her permanent home.

Looking for accomodation for a 4-5 week stay in September with 2 adults and a 4 year old.  We won't have transportation and would like to be close to (&hopefully walking distance) a safe beach and shops/food etc.  What areas would you recommend? We are unlikely to need daycare so this is not a factor

comments.comment: kamala
None of the beaches on the West coast are safe after mid may, when Riptide's and huge breakers arrive. As for accommodation, there's an abundance at this time of the year. No need to book ahead.

Kamala and Kata Beach are both excellent as you can walk most places and if you don't feel like it, there are taxis all over the place or you can call a Bolt easily. There are plenty of hotels from cheap to expensive. If you like to swim book a hotel with a pool as that time of year swimming on the beach can be dangerous some days, especially for your four-year-old. There are plenty of places to eat both Thai and Western food. Kata has everything you need. There are no "safe beaches" on Phuket that time of year. The waves come from the south west and hit all the west coast beaches the same. It's safe as far as community goes but it's not safe to swim unless you're an excellent swimmer. Surfing is good that time of year.
Suggest another time of year November -April

Is there an official electricity rate and is it the same for everyone?

I often see Airbnbs or private leases charging 6 to 9 thb / unit.

While I believe the official rate is around 4.5 thb / unit. 

Is there any reason why they charge so much, are these private electricity networks, or is this just a way for the owner to make more money?

subsubcomments: How does well water calculations work? I've never had to deal with them before, isn't it inside your land?

subcomments.subcomment: almost 11MWh per month??!!!
subsubcomments: Big villa
show off.
its a rental
I’m sure you’re paying way too much to have a good time.  Enjoy.

comments.comment: The PEA rate varies between 4-5 THB/unit depending on something I don't know  I'm paying in Saiyuan, Rawai 5.01 THB/unit this year. Higher prices are just a "hidden" way of getting an extra income for landlords.

subcomments.subcomment: it’s a progressive scale, the more units you spend the more expensive they are
You pay more when the cost of oil rises. There are certain surcharges, which is why it varies.

comments.comment: Now it’s around 5% plus a little ….anything else is landlord tax
4.12 baht/  includes tax's, 7% and service charge on my last months bill in Kamala.
I've paid ฿4.90 until a few months ago, now its ฿5.55/unit (Kata).

PEA has a progressive scale and it depends on the kind of contract you have, but a normal house/condo is around 4.2 (including the flat fee and taxes) if you spend less than 500 units, over that I believe it can go up to 5.5. Then there are some condos/residences that have been built with their own infrastructure (some of the older ones have generators) and the PEA contract is different (much like industrial stuff) and they invoice pretty much what they want under the cover of infrastructure maintenance. Outside of that it’s the owner/management company that is milking you
2 phase or 3? Makes a difference.
Yes , the reason is greed.
any way to avoid this? if i book using agoda or booking dot com is it the same?

If the landlord has less than a handful of rental units (I think 5) they can charge what they want. More than that they are breaking the law and the authorities can - and will - take legal action if notified.

subcomments.subcomment: The pic above is from a long term condo rental place with definitely more than 5 units
subsubcomments: Then go to your PEA office and report them.  Take with you all past and present bills. They will look into it.

comments.comment: This was made illegal in Thailand around 7-8 years ago. Report them and they'll lower the rate to the actual rate.

post_text: Mid october in Phuket, what is the weather like and how safe is it to travel to different islands like phi phi island? Is it safe to snorkel then?

comments.comment: Six years on Phuket for me still rainy season but might be better to the end…https://freedomdestinations.co.uk/.../rainy-season....

subcomments.subcomment: thank you. Hoping we can get out one day to snorkel and see an island. Planning to visit the rainforest. Where are the best waterfalls and rainforest in Phuket that can be visited in a day trip.
subsubcomments: You’re welcome. Think this will help you… https://www.alltrails.com/de/thailand/phuket/waterfall

Waterfalls are best in Phang Nga, up off the bridge. Accessible rainforest are in parks like Khao Sok, not a day trip. There is not much rainforest in Phuket, just about none, here is mostly building or agricultural areas. There are a lot of hiking groups around who get you into some pretty countryside and wonderful views but it's not tropical rainforest. That time of year the waterfalls are usually full and really moving, it's the best time of year to visit these.

comments.comment: Toss a coin! I've lived here three decades and some wet monsoon seasons are, err, wet... and others there's little difference between the dry season. The only real difference is the huge grey breakers on the West coast - definitely not for swimming. Most (sensible) boat tour companies are closed for the season - including the ones that go to Phi Phi.

Hi, I'm a local driver in Phuket. I would say I know Phuket very well so if you need help with private transfer for doing Phuket City tour or exploring other attractions in Phuket, I am happy to organise your trip and make your journey easier.Friendly service. Cheap price. DM me. WhatsApp + 66636094881

October is on the cusp and could go either way, it's the end of the rainy season right then so the weather is usually shifting from southwest to northeast. Flip a coin, that's the only way you'll know. November is more predictable. Having said that, if you're interest is going to Phi Phi, that's fine, you can go there all year around, there is always somewhere protected from the wind and waves (if there are any.) Racha or Raya Island is also nice that time of year, the boats can handle the weather most days, though I wouldn't book a speedboat trip in advance, just wait until you get here and book it then when you know the weather. There are plenty of tour operators doing these trips. Also Phang Nga Bay to the east of Phuket has many islands (though the snorkeling is not good) and you can visit these islands year around as well. You'll be fine, just don't book anything in advance.

My gf persisted and eventually we got a picture of it on a conveyor belt in Bangkok. Still told it was lost and to fill out the claim. Gf persisted. They then said they found it and would send it back to sender at our expense. We agreed. Next thing it arrived at its intended destination  they suck.

Flash are the worst courier service i have encountered. 3 times they delivered at night, did not ring the doorbell just left the parcel on top of the gate, twice a parcel had been thrown into the garden. Other companies call beforehand, Flash does not. Terrible service.
Flash are Trash!

The most disgusting courier service ever.

Just pay in advanced and write in Thai on your address next to your name to leave with security /lobby..(ไปฝากที่นิติบุคคล) never have to speak to or worry again..I get alot of packages and after a while it's the same guys delivering to you and they know the drill..sometimes they ring just say Wang wai tii lobby/security

post_text: My name is Lucy 😇 I was born on the street in Pattaya, I lived in fear for a year, I was offended by both adult dogs and people, I hid and was afraid of everyone and then I got very sick, I was on the verge of death, I weighed only 7 kg, it was hard for me  walk, I staggered and fell, I didn’t understand what was wrong with me, I felt very bad.  😔Kind people picked me up from the street, took me to the clinic, examined me completely, prescribed me medications and treated me for a month.  We moved to Phuket, now I am completely healthy and looking for a loving and caring family.  🥰I am 1 year and 4 months old, weight 15 kg, I am of average height.  I am treated for parasites monthly, have all my vaccines, have a microchip and a large travel carrier.  I am still afraid of strangers and dogs because of my street background.  But despite these characteristics, I am a very kind girl and I really like to run outside, I like to play with toys, I like to play with water in a basin.  If suddenly I have fallen into your soul and heart and you want to give me a permanent home, and you are ready to work with me so that I am no longer afraid of other dogs and people, then I will be happy if you come and meet me😇🥰😇🥰

comments.comment: so cute

post_text:
Khao Sok 

I'm in KS right now. I would like to highly recommend Khun Nitsawan Katerattanakul  at PlanIT - The Trip Planner  if you're looking to pre book a tour. I've lived in Thailand for 14 years and have never experienced online booking customer service at this level from start to finish, PLUS excellent prices. I asked a LOT of questions 🤦 and nothing was too much trouble and was always messaged back super fast. You can see the tone by the screenshots of emails I got.

We booked 2 tours (NOTE: we had own transportation so prices on the links do not include hotel transfers):

*Private lake tour for 3 people (5 hours including Coral cave with local guide with basic English). The price was WAY less that quoted by the hotels for a private tour.

On both tours we were met and greeted by someone who immediately directed us what to do and where to go.

*River tour bamboo rafting 1.5 -2 hr, private for 3 people with local guide.

https://www.planittripplanner.com/tour/58/private-khao-sok-lake-coral-cave-from-cheow-lan-pier

https://www.planittripplanner.com/tour/59/sok-river-tour-by-canoe-or-bamboo-raft-khao-sok-national-park

Tips if you book privately:

Start your tours early to miss the crowds and queues. We departed the lake at 8 am and so were ahead of the crowds at Coral Cave and for lunch.

Happy to give more details to anyone interested. Feel free to ask in comments or DM :) Or simply contact the company.

Hello everyone, I have poor water pressure in my condominium apartment in Patong, the office doesn’t seem to be interested in helping me because the pressure at the meter is fine (we changed the meter recently because of that but it didn’t do anything) so I guess that there’s a blocage somewhere, may be some silt accumulated. Anybody had a similar experience and could recommend a solution or a professional that could help?

Edit: the neighbors don’t have problems and the pressure at the meter is good

Edit 2: the filters and taps have been inspected and cleaned already, that’s not it

comments.comment: Sound more like it's a seasonal thing after there is not enough water on the island so that would have that effect.

subcomments.subcomment: no it’s not seasonal, it’s been like that for the last two years, just tired of it. Also the pressure at the meter is fine.
subsubcomments: Well noted so you're neighbours have the same issue or only you
only me
If only you and not the filter/tap,Your right there might be a pipe issue.Hope you can find a solution.

comments.comment: changing meter does nothing<first make sure the line is clear to u condothan u need a stronger pump

subcomments.subcomment: the neighbors don’t have problems and the pressure at the meter is good
subsubcomments: pressure at the meter does not matter , u need replace the pump between the meter and ur condo, thats where ur losing pressure

I am not sure what you mean, no other apartment has a pump after the meter, the building is responsible for bringing pressure to my apartment and apparently that works, we changed the meter because we thought it was broken and blocking the flow but that wasn’t it

comments.comment: Has your pressure always been low? Is your condo on an upper floor? If the pressure used to be fine but now low it’s probably a blockage or worn pump. If it’s always been low, perhaps the pump wasn’t suited for the task - especially if you are on an upper floor - pumps are rated for a certain flow at a certain head height - too small of a pump or wrong type could be possible reason.

subcomments.subcomment: the neighbors don’t have problems and the pressure at the meter is good

comments.comment: Check and clean all the filters

subcomments.subcomment: taps and filters have all been inspected and cleaned already

comments.comment: Check and  clean tap filters

subcomments.subcomment: taps and filters have all been inspected and cleaned already

comments.comment: Almost always the filters at the tap; they don't need to be there at all. They will unscrew with persuasion.

subcomments.subcomment: taps and filters have all been inspected and cleaned already

comments.comment: There is no water. Already being rationed in other provinces

subcomments.subcomment: my neighbors don’t have that problem

comments.comment: Is your Apartment at the end of the pipeline. I remember an Apartment I stayed in previously, one tenants water pressure dropped, when other Apartments turned on their taps.Effectively the water pump wasn't powerful enough, to accommodate all Apartments, if they turned on their taps at the same time.

subcomments.subcomment: no, it’s not an issue with the condo’s systems, the apartment is on the 5th of a 9 floors building and in the middle of the floor, and the neighbors don’t have that problem. Like I wrote in the post I think there’s a blockage in the main pipe in the apartment but I have no idea what to do to get it flushed
Have you investigated the on/off Valve. Is the valve fully open?
subsubcomments: yes it is, the valve is before the meter and when we disconnected the meter to replace it we tested the pressure coming from the rest of the building by opening the valve and there’s a lot of pressure there

Just check your Taps and Shower are the same or similar as your neighbours first!  Are there any special filters fixed to yours, reducing the pressure. If not, turn off the water valve and check the outlet pipes for blockages. You might need to place a rod through them to clear any blockage. Your pipe branch, may also have a small hole, crack or sealant issue, creating a leak. There must be a Company who offers this type of service

comments.comment: Check Water pump
this happens to me all the time… check all your blue water pipes if possible… one of them may have come loose and needs to re-glued back together.

subcomments.subcomment: wouldn’t there be a huge leak?

post_text: Hi everyone! I have a question for those who have acquired the Thai Retirement Visa. Are BOTH the 800,000 bhat security deposit AND the proof of 65,000 bhat monthly income required, or is it one or the other?

comments.comment: One or the other.

subcomments.subcomment: Awesome, Thanks!

comments.comment: In most cases (unless your embassy Issues income certifcates) you will need the 800k to secure the visa and the 1st extension.During the first year you will need to transfer internationally 65k or more each and every month for 12 months leading up to your second extension. Then you can apply for the 2nd extension using the income method.** make sure that you follow the 800k rules of the first year.Also if you you don't have the 800k when you apply for the Income method 2nd extension and you are denied for any reason you'd have to start all over.

There was talk once about importing water to Phuket from Phang-Nga province. Indeed, there will be water shortage in Phuket unless it starts raining soon. Luckily, rainy season is around the corner, hopefully providing enough rain to fill the reservoirs before next dry season. Water will be a problem for Phuket in the future.

subcomments.subcomment: Bad weather is already forecast and on its way. I wouldn't be surprised to read about flash floods in the coming days and weeks!

comments.comment: Yes its coming. We have already experienced the wells running dry in rental villas in Rawai & Nai Harn so if the rains don't come soon then definitely!

Pretty sure it’s going to happen. It has happened more and more over the past years   It has been fine for residents since Covid times but Phuket is incredibly busy now - for many reasons. Not least the influx of Russians since the war started, tourist levels running high, massive new building projects, extra water parks sucking water from the water table (many wells in Rawai area are the lowest they have been for years)Phuket hasn’t been this busy with humans for a LONG time - the sheer number of daily showers used, toilets flushed will almost certainly guarantee it will happen within the next 2 months somewhere here. Most of all though the issue is that this is nothing new, and they discuss it every year (apart from Covid years) but have done nothing to expand or add new catchments, dams or run-off collection. Still - got to love Phuket !

subcomments.subcomment: hopefully the provincial planners had all these issues in their plans. There are so many new projects going up these days.

post_text: Hello, does anyone use the Makro Pro online delivery service? I really cant stand going to Makro in person its so busy and takes forever. Shopping for a family means alot of food and it ends up being at least a half day worth of hassle just to go grocery shopping. Also the place can at times be full to the brim of people who dont know how to shop in a civilized manner and act like savages LOL.  It ends up just being a time consuming chore. It would be such a great time saver if the delivery option works as described without any annoyance or drama. Does anyone use Makro delivery? Maybe a restaurant owner or something that can share their experience? I would be ordering mostly bulk items and frozen goods. Appreciate any feedback from people who used it!

subcomments.subcomment: Yeah I use it a lot.   Way prefer it to going there.  If I’m not going to be home I leave a cold box outside the front door.   I find it works really well.  True they sometimes don’t stick to the schedule but on the whole I find it it a pretty good service.
subsubcomments: What about substitutions? Are they calling all the time and saying "no have" and making a drama out of it after youve already paid up front? And second, do you know if the truck they deliver in is refrigerated? One of the things I am most worried about is ordering frozen breads and meats and they show up extremely late and having been sitting in the back of an unrefrigerated truck all day in the Phuket heat/sun.
my frozen stuff has always arrived frozen.   I don’t recall ever getting a call or a substitution. Usually if they don’t have something they don’t send it and they reimburse.

comments.comment: I do and it’s a ballache. Only online payment for frozen food. They never keep to delivery times. Substitutes are ridiculous. And three times they just haven’t bothered to turn up at all.
I go to Makro around 8am, usually no queue at checkout.
I go at 6am when they open.  Very quiet then
I feel like this could be a business idea….
Works for  us . Buying in bulk for Restaurant and housekeeping but still need to go personally for certain things,like meat cuts .

subcomments.subcomment: Great info. So is it not possible to order frozen meats and stuff like that?
subsubcomments: frozen meat yes.  Unfrozen no.

comments.comment: Delivery is in refrigerated trucks, and free with a minimum order of 1,000 baht. We've not experienced ANY issue with their service - even with frozen products.

It’s fine - sometimes not great with sticking to timing so need to factor that in. Pay on delivery with QR or transfer if you’re ordering fresh products - if you miss them they’ll call and send you QR code to pay. Leave a cool box outside if needed. Everything frozen is still frozen on delivery but they don’t call if something is not available
I order online every two weeks and am satisfied. Delivery has always been on time.
At like 7-9am you don't even have to queue and the minced pork and beef are actually still red.
Didn't deliver on the day I booked it for and then came the next day and forgot to bring my frozen/refrigerated items.

comments.comment: It would contain high floride levels, I would go tops or villa market and get aqua panna or evian.

subsubcomments: I have a wholesale contact which i have delivered in bulk should you need it, works out cheaper in bulk.

subcomments.subcomment: City water is the best i have used in 27 years. I am in Thalang.
subsubcomments: thank you, and why do you think is the best?
The bottles are cleaned and sterilised before refilling something a lot of companies don't do. Especially those using opaque bottles. Taste is good too.

comments.comment: Phutalai... Total alkalinity ~150, ph 7.7, hardness 0, trace nitrite 1-10 mg/l, all others 0 including flouride, taste is very good. Have had a couple of bottles with particulates. 50 baht /large bottle delivered.

subcomments.subcomment: thank you! Do you have a contact  as they didn't reply me on Line

comments.comment: Yes we use Phutalae alsohttps://liff.line.me/1645278921-kWRPP32q/?accountId=yuf3889e
I like City water
Another vote for Phutalae! Been drinking it for years, I find it to be the best tasting drinking water  easy to communicate with them through Line, I see someone already shared the contact

Best water brands in Thailand are Aura and Christal. I know that from a Swiss Expat Chemical who tested lots of brands. I personal prefer Aura over 12 years. Wouldn’t  order normal water from any local company…
Aqua Clear is hands down the cleanest water you're going to find available. I did tests on it with tools I bought from lazada side by side to other brands, including ones from 7-11. Go with them.

subcomments.subcomment: thank you,  what did the test shows? Do you know pH and fluoride levels?
subsubcomments: You can actually ask them for that info, and they should have it from the factory they're partnered with. They had the best cleanliness level of all the ones I tested.

post_text:
Selling 2x 3 day passes for the HONG KONG 7‘S tournament 🏉

🗓️ April 5th - 7th

How is the craft beer scene in Phuket? 

How easy or hard it is to open up a craft brewery there? 

And has any farang done that?

comments.comment: A few tried, but didn't last long. Too many regulations.https://www.thaipbsworld.com/thailands-new-liquor.../....
There will be some craft beers today in the Phuket best burger competition, maybe there is someone you could talk to there  its in blue tree

There quite a few thing to go thru.To setting up a brewery.1:  You need to have some Thai partners to set up a company.It could be a Ltd company 2:  Then you need a brewing license from the Excise Department,3:  Apply for Excise Tax LicenseObtain an excise tax license from the Excise Department. 4:  Obtain the Food and Beverage LicenseApply for a food and beverage license from the local health department or municipality5:  Label ApprovalSubmit your beer labels to the Excise Department for approval. The labels must meet specific requirements, including accurate alcohol content, ingredients, and warning labels.
visit Beerfest restaurant & brewery Phuket
Very expensive. US-level prices. If you're ok with that, Phuket town has a couple.
Crafty Coyote

I wanted to start up a cottage/craft cider brewery but the red tape was too much. And the big companies have got the market by the balls. I suspect any sign of successful foreign competition would quickly be quashed, one way or another.

subcomments.subcomment: We can find a way to get a slice of the market. But yes red tape will take time , money and connections. May be I should start with something else first in Thailand.

There was talk once about importing water to Phuket from Phang-Nga province. Indeed, there will be water shortage in Phuket unless it starts raining soon. Luckily, rainy season is around the corner, hopefully providing enough rain to fill the reservoirs before next dry season. Water will be a problem for Phuket in the future.

don't worry Dave, the Thai plan is to build 10k new condios, and another 15000 new hotel rooms every year for the next 5 years. What is Phuket going to need water for?
subsubcomments: worry​ing​ prospect.​ Fortunately, the​ water​ pipe​line​ project​ from​ Phang Nga is​ progressing ahead​ of​ schedule, with​in​ budget.

comments.comment: official statement is that we have "plenty". Think about that when you have a dry shower;-)

No.  Have not heard anything yet but it is doubtless coming.
Not yet***$$
Need rain badly in Isaan as well. A lot of communities depend on the water level.
Bound to be a problem soon with so much development going on and no infrastructure improvements. Par for the course here.
There's some pretty severe weather forecast for early April, so enough rain should fall to fulfill any shortfall.
Have a well in Kata under the dive shop. A few time last year we had to get water tankers to top up.. but it was late April ...not this early..Give it a few more weeks should be some rain soon

subcomments.subcomment: Bad weather is already forecast and on its way. I wouldn't be surprised to read about flash floods in the coming days and weeks!

comments.comment: Yes its coming. We have already experienced the wells running dry in rental villas in Rawai & Nai Harn so if the rains don't come soon then definitely!

Pretty sure it’s going to happen. It has happened more and more over the past years   It has been fine for residents since Covid times but Phuket is incredibly busy now - for many reasons. Not least the influx of Russians since the war started, tourist levels running high, massive new building projects, extra water parks sucking water from the water table (many wells in Rawai area are the lowest they have been for years)Phuket hasn’t been this busy with humans for a LONG time - the sheer number of daily showers used, toilets flushed will almost certainly guarantee it will happen within the next 2 months somewhere here. Most of all though the issue is that this is nothing new, and they discuss it every year (apart from Covid years) but have done nothing to expand or add new catchments, dams or run-off collection. Still - got to love Phuket !

subcomments.subcomment: hopefully the provincial planners had all these issues in their plans. There are so many new projects going up these days.

post_text: Hello, does anyone use the Makro Pro online delivery service? I really cant stand going to Makro in person its so busy and takes forever. Shopping for a family means alot of food and it ends up being at least a half day worth of hassle just to go grocery shopping. Also the place can at times be full to the brim of people who dont know how to shop in a civilized manner and act like savages LOL.  It ends up just being a time consuming chore. It would be such a great time saver if the delivery option works as described without any annoyance or drama. Does anyone use Makro delivery? Maybe a restaurant owner or something that can share their experience? I would be ordering mostly bulk items and frozen goods. Appreciate any feedback from people who used it!

subcomments.subcomment: Yeah I use it a lot.   Way prefer it to going there.  If I’m not going to be home I leave a cold box outside the front door.   I find it works really well.  True they sometimes don’t stick to the schedule but on the whole I find it it a pretty good service.
subsubcomments: What about substitutions? Are they calling all the time and saying "no have" and making a drama out of it after youve already paid up front? And second, do you know if the truck they deliver in is refrigerated? One of the things I am most worried about is ordering frozen breads and meats and they show up extremely late and having been sitting in the back of an unrefrigerated truck all day in the Phuket heat/sun.
my frozen stuff has always arrived frozen.   I don’t recall ever getting a call or a substitution. Usually if they don’t have something they don’t send it and they reimburse.

comments.comment: I do and it’s a ballache. Only online payment for frozen food. They never keep to delivery times. Substitutes are ridiculous. And three times they just haven’t bothered to turn up at all.
I go to Makro around 8am, usually no queue at checkout.
I go at 6am when they open.  Very quiet then
I feel like this could be a business idea….
Works for  us . Buying in bulk for Restaurant and housekeeping but still need to go personally for certain things,like meat cuts .

subcomments.subcomment: Great info. So is it not possible to order frozen meats and stuff like that?
subsubcomments: frozen meat yes.  Unfrozen no.

comments.comment: Delivery is in refrigerated trucks, and free with a minimum order of 1,000 baht. We've not experienced ANY issue with their service - even with frozen products.

It’s fine - sometimes not great with sticking to timing so need to factor that in. Pay on delivery with QR or transfer if you’re ordering fresh products - if you miss them they’ll call and send you QR code to pay. Leave a cool box outside if needed. Everything frozen is still frozen on delivery but they don’t call if something is not available
I order online every two weeks and am satisfied. Delivery has always been on time.
At like 7-9am you don't even have to queue and the minced pork and beef are actually still red.
Didn't deliver on the day I booked it for and then came the next day and forgot to bring my frozen/refrigerated items.

Hello,

I am looking into getting a drinking water from City Water / Aqua Clear / Phutalae...

Can you please tell me what's your experience: water taste,minerals (fluoride..) which provider would you recommend for residential delivery in Thalang?

I found out the Aqua Clear water is normal drinking water with RO and pH 6.8 - 7.4 so I think to go with them... do you know of any better options?

comments.comment: It would contain high floride levels, I would go tops or villa market and get aqua panna or evian.

subcomments.subcomment: City water is the best i have used in 27 years. I am in Thalang.
subsubcomments: thank you, and why do you think is the best?
The bottles are cleaned and sterilised before refilling something a lot of companies don't do. Especially those using opaque bottles. Taste is good too.

comments.comment: Phutalai... Total alkalinity ~150, ph 7.7, hardness 0, trace nitrite 1-10 mg/l, all others 0 including flouride, taste is very good. Have had a couple of bottles with particulates. 50 baht /large bottle delivered.

subcomments.subcomment: thank you! Do you have a contact  as they didn't reply me on Line

Aqua Clear is hands down the cleanest water you're going to find available. I did tests on it with tools I bought from lazada side by side to other brands, including ones from 7-11. Go with them.

Selling 2x 3 day passes for the HONG KONG 7‘S tournament 🏉

🗓️ April 5th - 7th

How is the craft beer scene in Phuket? 

How easy or hard it is to open up a craft brewery there? 

And has any farang done that?

comments.comment: A few tried, but didn't last long. Too many regulations.https://www.thaipbsworld.com/thailands-new-liquor.../....
There will be some craft beers today in the Phuket best burger competition, maybe there is someone you could talk to there  its in blue tree

There quite a few thing to go thru.To setting up a brewery.1:  You need to have some Thai partners to set up a company.It could be a Ltd company 2:  Then you need a brewing license from the Excise Department,3:  Apply for Excise Tax LicenseObtain an excise tax license from the Excise Department. 4:  Obtain the Food and Beverage LicenseApply for a food and beverage license from the local health department or municipality5:  Label ApprovalSubmit your beer labels to the Excise Department for approval. The labels must meet specific requirements, including accurate alcohol content, ingredients, and warning labels.
visit Beerfest restaurant & brewery Phuket
Very expensive. US-level prices. If you're ok with that, Phuket town has a couple.
Crafty Coyote

I wanted to start up a cottage/craft cider brewery but the red tape was too much. And the big companies have got the market by the balls. I suspect any sign of successful foreign competition would quickly be quashed, one way or another.

subcomments.subcomment: We can find a way to get a slice of the market. But yes red tape will take time , money and connections. May be I should start with something else first in Thailand.

post_text: Do you ever get into a routine (rut) here in paradise island (phuket) and forget why you fell in love with this place? Without realizing I had (fallen into a rut) and just as easily I did all over again (fell in love). My third night in Kamala for the first time and went for a drive. Got lost in the hills and found my love again for this place. Lesson learned - don’t underestimate Phuket.

comments.comment: I live in Phuket but have to travel away for a few months. I have been away from Phuket for two weeks and I miss it madly!

subcomments.subcomment: and we miss you

comments.comment: Just go to bali for a bit and you will immediately appreciate the infrastructure

subcomments.subcomment: true dat

comments.comment: I guess the beauty in phuket for me isn't that it's exotic, but I feel there are more exotic places. Certainly better beaches in other places. You have a good sized international airport, some good beaches, world class healthcare, options for street food and luxury dining and you're in a decent location for exploring which is facilitated by infrastructure. Krabi is a nice alternative.Phillipines has better beaches but it's just too underdeveloped. Bali is stunning culturally but the beaches are lackluster and it has become a victim of it's popularity.There isn't really an analogue to phuket in Malaysia as far as I know, Vietnam I haven't been.

subcomments.subcomment: the Phils has Bohol which I lived before Covid. I didn’t like that many of the beaches were being walked off for developments and private access. Lived in Seminyak but didn’t like the traffic. Malaysia has Langkawi. Cambodia has Koh Rong. But for me Phuket is by far the best.
subsubcomments: rural bali is pretty okay for traffic

comments.comment: no idea how u can get lost in the hills in Kamala>now a drive out thru laguna an taking random turns is something different<  5555

subcomments.subcomment: trust me. I can.

comments.comment: Totally agree, love phuket but like anywhere it’s easy to get in a rut. We often go for drives at the weekend to find new places. Really enjoy going to phangna regularly too to explore

subcomments.subcomment: that’s exactly it. I didn’t even know about this area and its hills. Enjoy your road trips.
subsubcomments: you too Chris! We need to explore the Kamala hills, haven’t done that yet

comments.comment: I think it is important to have a set of activities that drives you and then you can enjoy the relaxing nature of this place.Training, study, work.

subcomments.subcomment: and the variety never ends

comments.comment: I've definitely lost my love for Phuket... it's not what it once was
It's all good until you have to drive somewhere on the main roads. Working 6 days a week will get anyone in a rut anywhere though

So many good things here! For me it is the combination of the beautiful nature/tropics, clean air, lovely food and the people. Friendly Thai people and a wide and eclectic mix of foreigners, most have travelled widely/worked in Asia, and many like outdoorsy activities. The good infrastructure keeps everything together. Yes, crowded in the dry season, but that is the price to pay for having this exceptional combination of good things in one place. Still working on improving my Thai language skills. From having lived in Indonesia with the easy-to-learn Bahasa I know that speaking the local language can make you enjoy your experience even more. Another great plus of Phuket is the possibility to explore the rest of Thailand by driving your own car which is a great convenience
Got to love all the farangs beating up police right?
Phuket WAS a paradise thirty years ago, but it certainly can't be described as that now - the tourism industry has almost totally trashed the island.

subcomments.subcomment: don’t bemoan the past if you’re blessed in the present.
subsubcomments: Bemoan is completely the wrong word, and I'm certainly not blessed in the present. If it weren't for my youngest son attending college here, I'd have left the island for a more desirable place in Thailand.

comments.comment: I came here to the paradise of Kamala fifteen years ago and pre Covid I returned pretty much every winter. However the developments of recent years have wrecked the beach and the surrounding woods. Too crowded, too expensive and it's both dangerous and irritating driving anywhere. I'm off.

subcomments.subcomment: I arrived on these shores in the early 90's, and by 2000 the island was already well on its way to losing it's 'paradise' title. Back then, if you wanted to buy a car, it had to be ordered from a showroom in Bangkok, where a driver would then personally deliver it to Phuket,  catching a bus back. Imagine that now!
subsubcomments: A changing world, my friend and in this case not for the better, for me at least. Of course people arriving here for the first time may well be as spellbound as you and I back in the days of our first glimpses and I envy them that. I've just got back from a three week motorcycle tour of the north west and, smokey air aside, I loved it, not least the prices I had feared were gone for good.

Funnily enough, I was talking to my wife about eventually moving North just a few days ago. But that's not going to be on the cards unless farmers are persuaded to stop burning sugar cain at the end of the season. I doubt I'll live long enough to see that day!

subcomments.subcomment: lived here since 96 ( except for 15 months over in Cambodia) still feels like home and so much more so in the low season.yes its changed, but please tell me where it has not?
subsubcomments: Fair points, Richard and perhaps the low season is the answer, although I come here to get away from the UK winters. All I'm saying is in the holiday season I'm finding the place unenjoyable to the extreme.

comments.comment: There are wonderful trails all over the island. Yes, you can get lost in the car but so much better to get out of the car and go exploring on foot. From Kamala you can walk up and over to the Kalim Viewpoint or over the range of hills to Kathu Waterfall.

subcomments.subcomment: I tried that in reverse, many years ago, but chickened out when the trail became unmanageable.
subsubcomments: the trails are much better marked these days with so many more trail runners in Thailand ( not saying you won't still get lost )

comments.comment: I hear you!
If it happens again go for a ride north of the sara-sin
More abandoned buildings along Kamala hills... memories indeed!

Can you help me please, I am 57 years old and have an Italian passport, I would like to stay in Thailand for a few 5 or 6 months, do 90 days and then leave and return again for another 60/90 with a border bounce, can you give me some instructions.  Thank you all.

comments.comment: You're old enough for a retirement visa that'll let you stay for 12 months at a time, then renewed at immigration office in the province you're staying without leaving the country. Trying to do it on multiple tourists visas will likely fail, if you obtained them back to back.

subcomments.subcomment: But if I make the 2 entries, one in 2024, then the other entry in 2025, what happens??
subsubcomments: You can leave and re-enter as many times as you want on a retirement visa, within 12 months. The only possible issue is that you need to have 800,000 baht balance in a Thai saving account for three months, before applying. If you can do that, it's by far your best option.
3 or 2. Ive just been told 2?

I think the current limit is 2 back to back tourist visas, but it's entirely up to the officer at the border - and how lucky you are. The official line is that they don't want anyone obtaining back to back tourist visas.
is it difficult to get a thai savings account 3 months before applying for the visa?
Yes! Most banks want to see the visa BEFORE opening the account... and you can't get the (retirement) visa without the bank account. It's really stupid.
this is what i thought...  thanks for confirming

Jay Bazil It's been that way for several years. Fortunately I opened my accounts more than 25 years ago, back in the days when when life was much simpler. If it's of any help, I've read that the Thanachart bank are more sympathetic to foreigners - but it'll still depend on the manger to make a final decision.
i was so close to opening an account 18 years ago but regret i didn't.
Jay Bazil It's not impossible, just needs a lot of running around and a lot of persuasive conversation.

comments.comment: guarda sito ambasciata thai in Italia e scegliti il visto che piu' ri aggrada...

post_text: How do you plan to handle the new Section 41, the taxing of money brought into Thailand?  My understanding is the American social security is not taxable.  However, the same from the UK is taxable.

comments.comment: Despite the new income law this year, you only pay tax in Thailand if you have registered and possess a tax number... and completed an annual self declaration form. There are no automatic deductions on money brought in. If you think you're eligible to pay, then declare it. Nobody will start looking for you unless you're regularly transferring huge amounts from offshore accounts, and the banks have raised a red flag.

subcomments.subcomment: correct

comments.comment: Super strange embassy. I had a lot of major problems with them, missed multiple flights. They closed down unexpectedly for 10 days with my passport, but the security guard kept telling me they were going to open in the next day or two. So I kept booking flights thinking I was going to get my passport back.  Just for an education Visa I had to print out literally 300 pages of every one of my bank transactions and stock trades.   It's a really weird place.     That's why I ho chi Minh is really difficult to get appointment and hanoi has any appointment available.  Sorry if my comments not helpful I just wanted to Vent. Good luck!!

subcomments.subcomment: I remember the grief you had there. Penang is my new favourite
subsubcomments: I’m thinking if it gets denied for whatever reason, I go to Thailand anyway on my visa exemption and then go to Penang for my TR visa in 1 month.
good move. Only thing with Penang is to get in the queue super early in the morning. But Georgetown is a cool place to hang out.
don't forget if you come in on a one month Visa you can extend it for 1900 baht at any immigration for a second month.
think that would kill my chances of getting approved for a TR after being in Thailand for 2 months visa exempt?

not at all. They only start questioning people doing tourist visa runs after 2 years here.  And right now they kind of made some clear guidelines because they gave Visa exempt to Chinese and Indians, but the stipulations of their visas they can't do Visa runs. But they specifically said that we can do Visa runs. Before it was always a gray area but at least there's some clear word in there but.   I lived here before covid for 6 to 7 years on the embassy tourist visa. But I would put two or three weeks between every trip.  in Jakarta thai embassy and similar ones, but you can totally do some Visa exemption in between. There's nothing illegal about it.  My only recommendation is don't do same day Visa runs to neighboring countries. If you do the embassy TR visas, do it a country or two away.  Every two or three years I would just get a new passport. Again you're not breaking any laws but you're just avoiding having uncomfortable discussions with immigration officers at airports. Land borders are always much easier. You could fly here for 2 months and then fly up to udon thani. Walk across the border have a nice week vacation in Laos, get a 2 month Visa extended it to three.   I just renewed my passport a year ago in Hanoi at the US embassy, took 7 days when everybody in the United States was on this weird 6 to 8 week thing which I think they still are.

one time I got pulled into the little room because I met some Australians on the plane who were super drunk and they were making tons of noise and the immigration officer thought I was one of them because they were talking to me. But when I went inside the office I just politely told them look at my passport, I said I have proper visas with two or three week breaks in between. I didn't have any same day Visa runs in that passport.   And they let me in. And this is when they were really cracking down on this but right now it seems very relaxed since the reopening
I'm surprised/curious you even need to do this mate. Why not do 90 day reporting like the vast majority. After all you have been here for a number of years now no?
oh I'm not doing border runs. It's a long story but my Penang mission was changing from Ed to Guardian. Had to be done outside. My renewal this year will be done in Phuket
kk

comments.comment: Tabien baan books always have the owners name on the first page. Immigration will want to see that it matches the name on the rental contact, ID card and Chanote land document. All will need to be in the same name and signed by the owner.

subcomments.subcomment: I believe this is not the case. From what I’ve understood reading the various Thailand law blogs, the tabien baan can often be empty if it’s not any Thai national’s main domicile. In this case, their domicile is a couple homes down, this one they own but nobody permanently resides there, hence, no name.Of course, embassy didn’t want to accept this despite their own website giving an (if any) qualifier on the requirement. I ended up booking (and later unbooking) a hotel.
subsubcomments: All the books that I've had in my possession have had the owner on the first page, and those registered as living there on subsequent pages. I've never seen one left blank.

Never contact Pacific cross insurance company.  For them, any illness before purchasing an insurance policy is considered chronic and treatment during the policy is not covered.  If you didn't indicate your previous illnesses on the form when you purchased the policy, they collect information from the hospital you usually visit and issue Exclusions listing all the illnesses in your medical history that are no longer covered by the policy.  So my daughter was not paid for treatment of ordinary viral pneumonia at Bangkok Hospital Siriroj in Phuket, because she had previously suffered from another viral pneumonia more than a year ago.  The certificate presented by the attending doctor stating that this was not a chronic disease and a new case was ignored by the insurance company.  They do not accept any arguments and ignores official documents from Hospital.

comments.comment: Be careful with internet rants in Thailand. If your policy included a Preexisting Condition Clause and you signed it the company is within its rights to deny coverage and is protected by law from online harassment or internet vigilantism. What you say about someone else online is seen differently than in the West.
So pre existing mate pretty simple
Pretty standard practice

subcomments.subcomment: Agreed

comments.comment: You mean "preexisting" and that's normal of all insurance companies.
Isn´t that what all insurance companies do all around the world?
That’s pre-existing and every insurance checks that. All insurances reach out to all bigger hospitals in Thailand and see if you have ever been there and what were the medicals.

subcomments.subcomment: Are the hospital allowed to give information about a patient? For instance, I noticed that when I call BKK Hospital in Bangkok call center they say in their waiting message that they will not provide any medical records about patients
subsubcomments: they will give it to the insurance companies. You can’t get it as an individual, but they can.

Posting libelous comments about a company in Thailand on social media, will land YOU in court with a defemation charge. Good luck!

subsubcomments: It costs 20 baht to register a defemation case at a local Thai court house (no police report necessary)... And this post contravenes the Computer Crimes act in Thailand.

This happened to me yesterday . Just stating this as it may affect your visa renewal. 
I went to Phuket immigration to renew my yearly retired visa. 
For the past years I’ve been using to show monthly income instead of having 800 K baht in the bank. Doing so, I was receiving a letter from the Embassy in Bangkok providing confirmation of my monthly income. NEVER had a problem before with that letter. Today, they did not accept it because of the last paragraph stating:
“In providing this letter, the Government of Canada accepts no responsibility or liability for the actions of the above named individual, whom it does not sponsor in any way.”
Not sure what I am going to do now but I will figure something out. 
Good luck to those that have that letter. 
I am told that the reason of this paragraph being added has to do with the new Consul. 
Go figure why 😤

P.S.

Here’s an update on my post. Returned to the Immigration and had another go at this with copies of the bank documents I had given the embassy to get my letter. 
It was obvious that what they were concerned with, was the last paragraph on the letter from the embassy. 
After spending time 40 mins or so, they decided to accept my renewal this year. 
However, they told me that next year if I get the same letter from the embassy, I would be refused. I have contacted the embassy and spoke with the consul and advised her of the reluctance from immigration in Phuket in regards to that last paragraph. She advised that she would be looking into that matter a bit further. I will let you know what comes from this if there’s any changes.

I also included last years letter and document supporting income.  They accepted it this year. The letter was needed because I was 10 days short, 1 month, on the bank deposit...The final point they made, no letter next year.
I guess they don't want us here anyone,even with buying a property and having THai kids.never mind lots more countries!!!???

Vehicle prices are based on a price guide giving a sale and buy price based on the vehicle condition. Noone selling would state "oh by the way the vehicle was flooded".
people like a bargain, there are lots of 'bargains' after rainy season
never seen it in 27 years. Plus, someone would question, i certainly would, why is it a bargain? Must be something wrong with it.

OK so let's agree you haven't seen it.Does lots of Thailand get floods in rainy seasons?Do lots of cars and bikes get flooded in rainy season?What do you think happens to these vehicles afterwards? Especially the uninsured ones?
There is probably 200 cars flooded each year compared to hundreds of thousands vehicles bought and sold daily.
You are wrong by a factor of about 50. Google it
while I think "flooded cars make a bargain" is spurious I AM sure prices drop in low season in Phuket. Work gets thin, people get hungry, market shifts to buyer favor.

ADOPTED. Happy Husky !. Thank you

Husky !!. This lovely young Boy was kept on a 1 metre piece of chain. His movement was so limited he struggled to walk. Thanks to a kind passer by and the persistence of The Bodhi Dog Rescue and Shelter in Paklok they secured his release and now lives at the shelter. Hes put on weight and after regular exercise his legs etc all work fine. 

Hes young, maybe 18 months, hes fit, healthy and loves people as you can see. 

His life at the shelter is much improved but he would love his own family and he deserves it.

Obviously Huskies need a good daily walk and a safe garden space. Ideally for an active family or individual.

Would anyone like to give him a home ?

You can meet him at The Bodhi Shelter or contact Tina Maria who runs the shelter.

https://www.facebook.com/share/r/rWEeciLFH7Zi8B6D/

Hes ready to go !

comments.comment: You know what would be great is if he could go with someone to be in a cold country!!! He’s beautiful!!!

subcomments.subcomment: maybe but actually its a bit of a myth that its a problem in hot countries. Their double coats are as much protection from the heat as the cold. I had a husky and he loved going out for a run at any time of day even in the midday sun !
subsubcomments: yes I agree, I’ve had 2 huskies boarding with me for over 2 years now and as long as you keep them groomed well, I.e brushing the loose hair out regularly, they keep their body temperature regulated well.
indeed and hydrated. He genuinely wasnt bothered whatever the temp as long as he had a snooze in front of the fan when we got back !
these two are the same, they have the choice of a/c, fans etc but mostly choose to sit outside and sometimes even in the sunshine, they’re as happy as can be.
indeed. It seems mad but dogs love the sun but generally for maybe 20 mins or so. I guess its vitimin D ?
they actually don’t have the ability to synthesize Vitamin D through the skin like we do, I think they just like basking in the warmth as we do
ive learnt something !
every day is a school day
such a pretty dog. I’m canadian so I can totally see him in the snow!
he'd love that !. If only Canada would open the doors to thai dogs again !
they do (the stopped during covid but can now). My friends took some recently from bkk to Vancouver. Maybe they need to as accompanied baggage though.
ah, i thought it had stopped. I stand corrected !

Hi i'd like to buy a kitchen appliance from USA, anyone is aware about the import taxes? Cost around $2K to buy in USA, what am I expected to pay to customs and how it works?
2) What is my friend from USA send to me ? 
Thank you!

comments.comment: sometimes it just goes through, sometimes you get a customs bill to pay from dhl, about 30% of declared cost
Do you have a step-down transformer to use it as well?  US is 110V and we're 220V out here
Does not make sense at all. Buy in Thailand.
Buy in Thailand, most are made in China anyway.  Better price here.  Makes absolutely no sense to buy in America and shipped to Thailand.

30% duty and 7% VAT this covers both the product price (you will need to provide a commercial invoice to customs) and the shipping cost. Yes double whammy I'm afraid.  can help you import and clear customs, but those costs are very high unless you absolutely want your appliance.
Thank you very much all! I understand it doesn’t worth
220V AC vs 110V AC. Buy in Thailand

subcomments.subcomment: they can send 220V version from USA. Can't find this in Thailand.

post_text:
Does anyone simply use a Water Filter that attaches to your Sink or one of those Pitcher Pouring ones you fill and put in your fridge? 

If so, what kind?

comments.comment: I would NOT depend on either of those for clean drinking water. They may filter some impurities but do not kill bacteria which can ruin a perfectly fine day. Stick to the big blue jugs. I have used a Brita filter/pitcher for water that was filtered in a condo vending machine… because I didn’t believe it was actually working properly
Brita pitchers or those activated carbon faucet filters don´t really do anything to remove pesticide traces or kill bacteria and viruses. Like trying to catch flour with a colander.

subcomments.subcomment: yes!

comments.comment: Bought this Mazuma at HomePro. Been using it close to 2 years now. Very pleased with it.
Been using 20ltr bottles for close on 27 years. Just avoid the opaque bottles they are not cleaned before refill.
I would just have a machine that takes 20L water bottles, I get my water from City Water 4 bottles per month, done that for 5-6 years.. Best decision ever..

-- Driving license --
I've had my car license for about 10 years, now wanting to get the motorbike license too.  Do I need to do all the steps anyone would do to get the motorbike license?  Or since I have the car license, is it a bit different?  

I see there are driving schools too.  Can I do everything there instead of at the government office?  Pros/cons?  When I got my car license in Chiang Mai, I did everything at the government office, so I'm not sure how the schools work.  If it costs a bit more, but saves time/hassle, I'd be interested.

Thanks for any advice.  I know there are a million videos and blogs about this, but they are focused on getting your first license, not my situation.

comments.comment: If expired, you have to start from scratch

subcomments.subcomment: mine is current

it is not valid to get renewal from 1 year after expiry date I have been told at the DLT Phuket. I have ne et been late applying for a new driving licence but when I was there recently with my Thai partner she asked them and they confirmed this. I had heard people say that many times so I was curious and asked them directly.

comments.comment: This license expired 3 years ago so you have to start from the beginning again. Do car and bike same time.

subcomments.subcomment: my license is current, the photo is not my license

comments.comment: Car license = 2 days trainingMotorbike licenses= 2 days training10-wheelers: 3-5 days Note that there are 2 types of motorbike licenses as well: normal licenses for 80-400cc bikes and big bike licenses for 400cc or 47hp engines on up.

subsubcomments: for swimming there is Nai Harn Beach. Next beach down is Yanui where many families take kids. Can hire canoes and paddle out to the small island and snorkel. Then there is Rawai Beach that has many long tail boats, people can do a private trip to the local islands for a low price. Many people like to exercise around Nai Harn lake, there is an outdoor exercise equipment area. Also can walk up to the windmill or even do the bush walk from Nai Harn Beach to Blackrock lookout, that's a big one. There are kite surfing schools in Chalong Bay, people can learn to kite surf and wing foil or can hire paddle boards or try the E foil. Some shops hire bicycles to ride around the area. There are many Thai boxing gyms, the kids might want to try a training session. That's all I can think of at the moment

This thread is pretty amusing! I've had a house in Rawai since 2006. When my old friends come to Phuket that have been coming here for over 30 years come, they stay in Kata. They like walking from their hotel to the beach right there at the southwest end of Kata. Good restaurants right around there. Everything is more walking distance from their hotel. My wife and I go over for a few days while they are here and hangout on the beach there. Probably less crowded than Nai Harn that's right down the street from my house. Rawai is overcrowded these days. I live in a quiet neighborhood and don't want to go out in the traffic all that much. Great bunch of motorcycle riders around here. I see a lot of accidents involving Russians and Thai automobiles and minibuses. I guess if you get a hotel right on Nai Harn, there are some restaurants there, but not the selection of restaurants that Kata has within walking distance. My 2¢...
Rawai

Rawai no question

For first-timers to Phuket, unless you've done a lot of research and are sure you know where you want to stay, I recommend you stay in, or near, Patong. Patong isn't one big party, but it is busy. If you think it may be too busy, stay in Kamala, immediately north of Patong, or Karon/Kata, immediately south. All three places have a nicer beach than Patong Beach. All three are less than 15 minutes away from Patong by Bolt or taxi. There are many beautiful towns farther away from Patong, north and south, and you should visit them this trip to see if you want to stay in one of them the next trip.
Kamala
Rawai
Kamala
rawai no beach

post_text:
Property rental question
I rent a property in rawai. Their has been a lawsuit against the property I'm currently renting. The new owners have now taken over but im in the old contract until it expires in May. My deposit is with the old owner who is refusing to pay it back to me or directly to the new owner.  They said they would only pay it back if give them the sofa that belongs to them in my place, but it's not mine to give as it now belongs to the new owner. The new owner is saying i need to chase them for my deposit, otherwise I will have to pay another desposit with the new contract! What is the best approach from here? Can anyone help me?

comments.comment: How much are we talking about?

subcomments.subcomment: it's 13k but that is a lot for me if I have to find another deposit

comments.comment: Give them the couch!

subcomments.subcomment: yeh that makes sense.
subsubcomments: Anonymous member not your problem, you want your money

comments.comment: Try and agree a meeting of all parties and discuss in person. Does the new owner want to have you as a tenant? Can the new owner leverage the previous owner on anything regarding his new owbership, to incorporate your deposit? Ie deduct the deposit from owed funds.

subcomments.subcomment: they are not talking.  It's pretty messy.
subsubcomments: Anonymous member they must of had some communication to sell/buy the property. To me if there should be an inventory list with what's included in the sale. If the Sofa is mentioned then it's the Buyers, if not then it still belongs to the seller. Perhaps you should terminate your rental contract with the old landlord, obtain your deposit and allow him to collect his inventory. Upon collection you receive your deposit. You then start a new rental with the current owner (if they want a tenant).

comments.comment: Seems straight forward ... One of them is lying cause either the new owner bought the contents including the couch or he didn't... If he didn't let the old owner take it, if he did then tell the old owner you know the truth and will goto the authorities if it's not returned.

subcomments.subcomment: do I need to contact the police? Would they help or just laugh. The new owners are telling me I need to pay them rent but I don't have any documentation, so I'm not even sure who to believe is still the owner
subsubcomments: Anonymous member hopefully someone more adept at the reporting the process comments, but the rental laws here are very strict, and seem to heavily favour people renting... Not sure how easy it is to get them enforced but in the past I heard it's an easy process. Google it I guess and/or hopefully someone here as done the same
thank you

comments.comment: Go to the police station and file a report.  They will call the first owner in for questioning

subcomments.subcomment: ok thank you that is good advice

comments.comment: I doesn't work that way. The lease is attached to the house unless you agreed otherwise in the contract. DM me the contract

Id just give the couch back, in exchange for my deposit, the new owner may not even have rights to the couch, and even if so, they told you to chase the deposit, here it is, you chased it, did what needed to be done.

post_text: Hi, I just moved to phuket city with my father. I am looking to find a local lawyer who can help wtih British estate issues.

comments.comment: Hi Mark, as a solicitor of England and Wales overseas and no longer practising because I have been here 21 years, I recommend you generally do not use any England and Wales lawyer overseas because their qualifications will be 'stale' unless they are maintaining their practice qualifications through Continued Professional Development points (you can check with them but there aren't many. There are a good few in Hong Kong who are completely up to date) . You can use a solicitor in the UK remotely through video calls and audio calls, but choose a practice that is responsive and doesn't use a difficult appointments system so you can actually get access to the lawyer helping you (many high street practices were notoriously difficult to communicate with when I was there).

I would be shocked if a local lawyer had any knowledge of that, but maybe call your embassy and ask them. I know when I looked for something easy for the US estate system no Thai lawyer had any clue at all. Even finding a notary is not easy here. And why should they know? Different laws, different country.

post_text:
Hello everyone! 🌏
I hope you're all doing well. I'm reaching out to seek your advice and experiences regarding obtaining a tourist visa for China from Phuket, Thailand, particularly as a UK passport holder. 🇬🇧✈️🇨🇳
Has anyone recently gone through this process? I would greatly appreciate any tips, guidance, or recommendations you might have.

comments.comment: I just tried this last week. It's not possible. Phuket does not process UK passports . The end. Brexit, the gift that keeps giving .

My wife, who holds a British passport, tried and failed recently to get a China visa at the Chinese consulate in Phuket (as opposed to pre-Brexit days when it was easy). The only centres now are Bangkok and Chiang Mai. The process in Bangkok proved to be efficient and friendly, but make sure you have all the paperwork and relevant photocopies. It requires two visits to Thamapoom Tower in Bangkok, one to submit everything and the second a minimum of two days later to collect your passport. All the details and application form are at https://www.visaforchina.cn/globle/Hope that helps.

subcomments.subcomment: thank you so much David. Really appreciate it.

‘Khok Nong Na’ is an amalgamation of three Thai words that encapsulates key elements: a small ridge (Khok), a weir, or low-head dam (Nong) and a rice paddy (Na). Its key principle is to store sufficient water in three main areas in a balanced ecosystem that distributes moisture naturally throughout the plot while optimizing landscaping and water conservation, and therefore reducing water costs. Hey guys, hoping for a bit of advice.
Been here 3 years and always struggle renewing my retirement visa because of Bangkok bank documents.
All branches this year are telling me if I want a 1 year statement it takes 1 week to get it from head office. This makes the process nearly impossible as you need to sync all the dates and balance with your bank book etc.

comments.comment: There is no solution apart from get an account at another bank. I went to Krungsri, they can give you a one year statement on the spot in any branch.

comments.comment: you can get the one year statement in 5mn using their mobile application, I’ve been using that for my last 2 renewals

subsubcomments: you still need to go to the bank in the morning to get the letter and update your book but Phuket immigration took the print out of the 1 year statement just like that (I printed it out at the shop in the parking) the last 2 times I did it, hopefully it didn’t change. What helps as well is to have a separate account for your funds, that way there is not discrepancies even if the statement is a week old

just do everything on the same day, no discrepancies

oh really, i don t understand then ,they gave me mine 15 days ago..sorry

but you need statement 6 months no 1 year

What finance method are you using? 800k or monthly income? That could explain the difference
i'm married with thai girl400k baht
if you have many problem try to use agent....may be.....

great, but the requirement s for retirement extensions are not the same as a marriage extension. I have done both over the past 17 years I have been here. I currently know all about it. I couldn't extend my non O based on marriage this year since they now make us register our marriage with the local ampur. To do that the marriage certificate has to be approved by the Thai Foreign Ministry. The Foreign requires the marriage certificate to be certified by my government. The US is very hard to get certified documents from, so I will have to do it in the US and the Thai Embassy for next year. This year I had to go to KL to get off my non "O," come back on 30 days. Go to Phuket Immigration have over ฿800k in the bank the same day you apply that must remain above that balance for two months and not go below ฿500K, then has to be back up to over ฿800K two months before you apply for next year's extension. It all used to be easy! Now it's ridiculous! Two and a half hours at Bangkok Bank in Chalong and then another 2.5 hours at immigration, having to get my landlord out there and finally got it turned in. My paperwork was together but my landlord's had a couple of issues he had to fix.

subcomments.subcomment: the rule say 6 month...
Nope its defiantly 1 year now , and needs to go right back to the date you applied for your last visa extension , just done mine in January
not the same visa, different rules

comments.comment: Get the statement every quarter. They issue while you wait. Or do it yourself online. Older than six months is the issue. Don’t wait til the end of the year. Or, get it at 11 months then pop in for the one month outstanding. It’s easy as can be.
Available online. One year. Recent change. Print and has sentence at end saying no seal necessary. Still need signature & seal for balance
SCB print out whilst you wait, i always go the day before, statement and letter takes around 20 minutes.

subcomments.subcomment: Immigration doesn't give you a hard time about the statement being dated the day before your renewal visit?
subsubcomments: Not in 5 years. Sometime i will do the statement in the morning and visit immigration in the afternoon, i think twice in 5 years.

comments.comment: SCB walk in bits for immigration, letter pls & bank statements, ok 10min 400B pls, that's any branch, just make sure you have passport with you & make sure they sign & stamp officially, i do it all on the same day as i go to renew or what is extension to retirement visa, last time at immigration a young guy, very helpful, he checked all my paperwork, pls sit Mr Colin, he filled out all the paperwork, Mr Colin pls sign here here here, ok straight in 1900B, photo then out, ok pick up after 2pm tomorrow, i honestly thought wow now that was slick, over 10 years of retirement extensions, never had any issues, always yes Sir, thankyou Sir, but i always personally thank them speaking Thai, they never forget you for been respectful & polite

It really depends on the police officers mood. You:.. sorry… your friend could be let off with a warning but my friend (not me…actually my friend) got stung 20000.Police make the rules and the consequences up on the spot for foreigners.

subsubcomments: yes sir.

yeah your friend is a sucker. The first time I got stopped in Thailand the cop asked for 20k. I said "sir please take me to jail" it's because of lottery tickets like your boner friend that they even try that shit.

lol… ok terry tuff kunt. The fun fact is you could probably actually spend a few nights in jail if they refuse to pay a fine and riding without a helmet or without a licence CAN be up to 10000 baht now (legally, not just some shit they try on you)I guess some people don’t actually want to go to jail so they don’t roll that dice

I was talking to a lawyer a bit ago and brought up the subject of the police extorting a local business we are friends with. The guy said, "your friends don't have a problem with police. They have a problem with criminals who are police."If they are willing to cuff you over refusing to pay a made up fine they are willing to just rob you. Shrug. I like toilet paper and cigarettes, but I'm not willing to give the guard a blowjob to get them. And if keeping on the right side of the law is the priority... Probably don't ride in the tunnel with no helmet or license.
that’s my point bro. They ARE willing to blatantly rob you

comments.comment: What's wrong with going in tunnels?

subcomments.subcomment: Daniele SegantiniI I wonder about that as well, I don’t see any reasons to ban motorbikes from tunnels
there’s a big traffic sign at the entrance saying that bikes are not allowed in.
it’s against the law. Easy.
big signs for motorbikes not allowed in tunnels everywhere
because when they were first built the huge tiles on the walls and ceilings had a habit of falling off- if they hit you on a bike you’re dead for sure
No Ventilation?

No I believe it's because when they first built the underpasses, many motorbikes and bikes with sidecars were using them. They tend to drive the same way in the tunnel as they do on the road: Passing using the opposite lane, passing within the lane and hanging U-turns wherever they want etc. At one point early on a whole family was on a bike with sidecar...hung a U-turn and were all taken out by a car coming in the other direction.

‘Khok Nong Na’ is an amalgamation of three Thai words that encapsulates key elements: a small ridge (Khok), a weir, or low-head dam (Nong) and a rice paddy (Na). Its key principle is to store sufficient water in three main areas in a balanced ecosystem that distributes moisture naturally throughout the plot while optimizing landscaping and water conservation, and therefore reducing water costs. Dear Phuket expat Community,
Become a Blood donor and help save lives.
In your local expat community 

If you are from a Western Country, please donate. 

 Rh-Negative is EXTREMELY RARE in the Thai population.   One of the World's lowest prevalences of Rh-Negative.    0.3%

The Western Population has the highest percentage.   15%.       We have it.   

*******

No Alcohol 24 hours prior.
No Weed 24 hours prior.
No aspirin 48 hours prior.
No antibiotics 7 day's prior.
Age Under 60 if first-time donor in Thailand,
70 year's if previous donor in Thailand.
Healthy, low-fat meal at least three hours prior.

Donation to Phuket
 Red Cross,
38/34 Rattanakosin 200 Pi Rd, Talat Nuea, Mueang Phuket District, Phuket 83000

Donors from the United Kingdom 🇬🇧, France 🇫🇷 or Ireland 🇮🇪 who lived there between 1980-1996 can donate at the National Blood Centre in Bangkok on Henri Dunant Rd ONLY.

Special processing for blood needed due to vCJD "Mad Cow Disease".   The National Blood Centre ONLY.

There was an article on Asean now daily about a year ago regarding the opening of bank accounts on a tourist visa. The problem was in the past it was very easy , all you had to do was go to any Thai bank with your passport and they would open an account for you and you could walk out 20 minutes later with a bank account and an ATM if you wanted one .What happened over past several years was so many tourists were opening bank accounts to avoid paying ATM fees , then withdrawing the balance at the airport and abandoning  the account.  The banks were left with around 2.6 million dormant bank accounts and so over the past 2 years the banks have now stopped allowing people on a tourist visa to open a bank account.  It  seemed to get a lot stricter over the past year with only Bangkok bank allowing it as long as you bought there insurance but  i have learnt from the Patong branch 6 months ago that this is now impossible. For example now , its a catch two situation for someone arriving on a tourist visa then trying to open a bank account to deposit 800,000 to obtain a Non Immigrant O based on retirement.
