#phuketschoolofmusic
#theredsquarecafe

Artist Profile:
Vladimir Gapontsev

Vladimir Gapontsev was born in Volzhskiy, Russia in 1985, and began to play the guitar at age 11. In 1997 he won a local guitar competition. In 2000 he entered the Volgograd Municipal College of Arts and in 2004 he continued his studies at guitar at Serebryakov Institute of Arts in Volgograd, studying under with Sergey Matokhin. During his studies he won prizes at many international guitar competition in Russia and abroad and won scholarships from the Administration of Volgograd Region (2002), Ministry of Culture of Russian Federation (2003), Federal Agency of Culture and Cinematography ("Young talents of Russia", 2006).
Since 2005 he has been a regular participant of international master classes in Russia and Europe.

Vladimir began teaching in 2006 as a classical and electric guitar teacher at the Serebryakov Institute. In 2010—2012 he was a guitar teacher at Igumnov music school, Moscow. In 2014, he is regularly invited as a performer, teacher and member of the jury to international festivals in Russia, Ukraine, Romania, Israel and other countries.

As a solo player and a chamber musician, Gapontsev has performed at venues such as Glinka state museum of musical art, Moscow Conservatoire Grand Hall, Central House of Journalist in Moscow, Vladimir Philharmonic Hall, S. Prokofiev museum, State Tretyakov gallery, Volgograd Central Concert Hall, Elena Obraztsova Cultural Center in Saint-Petersburg, Royal College of Music, London and others.

Besides solo recitals and teaching, he is also devoted to chamber music, arrangement and composing. Since 2012, Vladimir has been a member of the Russian Guitar Quartet, a group of musicians concentrated on professional playing the original music of modern Russian composers. He also performs guitar concertos with symphonic orchestras in Russia and abroad, and collaborates with musicians of different styles including classics, jazz, bossa nova, and folk.

Gladwin Pantastico

Mr Gladwin Pantastico obtained his Bachelor of Music in Classical Guitar at the Conservatory of Music in University of Santo Tomas, Manila, Philippines. He studied under the tutelage of Professor Ruben F. Reyes and performed as member of the UST Guitar Quartet and Ensemble.

During his studies at the UST Conservatory, he participated in several classical guitar competitions and received awards including the top prize at the University of the Philippines “Gitara” Competition by the Spanish Embassy in Manila and 2nd prize at the Cultural Centre of the Philippines National Music Competition for Young Artists.

As a soloist, he has performed extensively and participated in various International Music Festivals in the Philippines, Thailand and Singapore. He has performed Castelnuovo Tedesco’s “Concerto in D” with the University of the Philippines Chamber Orchestra and Joaquin Rodrigo’s “Concerto Madrigal for Two Guitars” with the UST Symphony Orchestra.

He also premiered a work for two guitars by Dr Robert Casteels, Chiaroscuro, with classical guitarist Manuel Cabrera II at the Esplanade Recital Studio in July 2012 and a piece for solo guitar by Filipino composer Danny Imson, “On Taking Changes” at the Yong Siew Toh Conservatory of Music Concert Hall in April 2013.

comments.comment: I use Taksin Consultants just south of Phuket Town, they are extremely helpful and offer me different quotes each year for renewal. Roojai seems to be cheap, but I am happier dealing with people I know, rather than save 100baht and risk it. https://maps.app.goo.gl/fK6GRGTmbEjBC2pW8?g_st=ic
This one is good and easy to do online      https://roojai.page.link/ybBS

subcomments.subcomment: agree

comments.comment: Or if you send me your vehicle information I can get you a quote from AXA Thailand.  https://direct.axa.co.th/Motor/GetQuote/Agent/9979506F85
Check out Roojai and get an online quote for comparison.

subcomments.subcomment: best one yet

comments.comment: I used to use Ayutthaya Insurance and they were great with claims but not so good about reminding me when the premium was due. It was never an issue when I forgot for a while, they covered me. But when I bought a new car from a 2nd hand dealer, the staff there does the shopping for me and presents me with several options each March. In general my wife is very good about shopping around for insurance, she has insurance up the yin-yang, i.e. insurance for everything. But for my car she couldn't find a better deal than my car dealer did. I pay less than RooJai. How much and what it entails can really depend on the type of car you have too, and of course, how old it is.

subcomments.subcomment: I have an MG and the dealer and insurance don't remind me as well. A friend with a rental company sent me to a staff at Toyota Pearl. They have nearly all insurance companies, even the insurance that I had, remind me on time, make the tax and informed me about the different kind of contracts. But she speaks only Thai, what is fine for me. It's all about the agent. Funny to pay the premium to Toyota for a MG. And I pay a bit more for a contract where I can go to the dealer. And when I needed them, they worked perfect for me.
subsubcomments: Yes, speaking Thai (and now reading and writing which you'll recall I learned during Covid) makes a huge difference. None of the staff at my car dealership speak English except the owner. We communicate by Line App and phone and in person, it all works very well. I'm super happy with House of Cars in Thalang. I am treated like a king there. But yes, I have heard that Pearl does that. They are a huge business now, and these kinds of services are well needed in Phuket, and inevitable with the economic success that people have had here. How do you like your MG? There sure are a lot of them on the road these days, it's like every other car I see these days, when it used to be Hondas and Toyotas.

I love my MG, the dealer where I bought it (at this time the only one) is rubbish. But MG pushed the Thai market, since the main production is in Thailand. The dealer at Bypass is great.And a good service keeps customers. I am sure there are more good insurance agents out. And some are just to stupid to make a business. Play Based Learning 🎉🎉🎉
Open House

ELT Phuket School Presents Seasons in Colour
Date: 01 July 2023
Time: 10:00 am
Fee: NONE

Pre-registration required, please e-mail monica.eltphuket@gmail.com to register or alternativelyfind us on telegram @eltphuket

Station 1 - Small World Seasons
Role-Play focus
This station focuses on imaginative play which uses toys or props. It encourages
children to use these small props and their imaginations to create detailed and playful
worlds. They can use a range of tools to inspire their play, including toys you can make
together.

Station 2 - Spring Into Learning
Discovery Learning Focus
Discovery learning in early years is a way of learning that puts children in the driver's
seat. Children learn by exploring, investigating and testing the world and objects around
them. They are given the chance to work on problem-solving and experimenting while
they use their imaginations to get creative.

Station 3 - Autumn Leaf Fall
Arts and Crafts
This station focuses on the development of children’s artistic and cultural awareness
supports their imagination and creativity. It is important that children have regular
opportunities to engage with the arts, enabling them to explore and play with access to
a wide range of media and materials.

Station 4 - Sandy Beach
Fine-Motor Skill Development
Fine motor skills are the ability to make movements using the small muscles in the
hands and wrists. These skills involve the coordination of the hands, fingers, and eyes.
Improving these skills is a really important part of our development, as we use fine
motor skills in a variety of ways every day.

Station 5 - Winter Wonder
Enquiry-based Learning
This station emphasizes a pupils' role in the learning process and asks them to engage
with an idea or topic in an active way, instead of sitting and listening. This learning
approach is all about asking questions and being curious.Children have the space to
ask questions and follow their own path to learning. It encourages them to follow their
own interests and passions.

post_text:
This little boy is looking for his forever family. His name is Aiko and he is about 2 years old. He looks like a German Shephard but is about half the size (15kg).

He is very calm and loves to snooze. Hes great with people and children. Hes not great with cats but has lived very happily with other similar sized dogs in a family home (foster home and trial adoption) and is mostly the submissive one.

The only issue is he needs a firm hand on his walks as he interacts firmly with other dogs who get close when he is on a lead. He is not a big dog but you still need to be firm and fit !. I think he craves his freedom so perhaps walks in safe areas where he can have time off the lead would be good.

Dont be put off, he is an incredibly beautiful and gentle boy and would be great people/families who are fit and active.

Hes based in Rawai and you can meet him anytime x

Hi All,

I’ve had my wallet stolen and need to replace my Thai driving license  - anyone know the process / what documents I need? 

Thanks 🙏

comments.comment: Do you have photo of your Thai license?

subcomments.subcomment: maybe somewhere…
subsubcomments: Ash James if you have print it as well

subcomments.subcomment: -Copy passport + last stamp-residence certificate or work permit -medical certificate-photo of thai license (if you have)
ooh following this as I lost my licence and need to get it replaced too! thank you so much for explaining!
subsubcomments: you’re welcome

comments.comment: replacing lost/stolen/expired license ( less than 1 year) Is all same< ( dont say its stolen, say lost)\Certificate of residency or wp, medical, copies of ur passport/visa, copy of license if you havego with all docs to motor vehicle dept and make an apt.

subcomments.subcomment: if lost you can inform officers, they will check. Just bring all documents
Why not say its stolen?
subsubcomments: need police report

comments.comment: You will probably need to report the loss to the police and take the police report also with the other documents. Once they run your name and details through their computer they will know that your previous licence is still in date so will know it’s been lost or stolen.
If nothing has changed than a police report and passport. They just print it new. It costs a small fee for printing (something like 100 THB). But it's a few years ago when I had the issue.
DLT QR licence app if you have the old photo you can scan and get the copies here
It's like a renewal but please check. It varies by province and day of the lunar cycle and direction the wind is blowing

If u have a photo and/or the Thai driver licence is number you can download the the DLT app and you can have it online which is then totally valid to show any police if you are stopped. It’s very handy and will be good to do until you get it replaced.
Thanks all for the guidance !
police report / go to dlt / done

Just updating everyone on my progress of evaluating eSIMs. I have been still evaluating Keepgo on one device and have using Airalo on another device. Before that I tried out Surfroam. Previously I determined Surfroam not to be a viable option and now I have determined that Keepgo is also just a rip-off. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY ON KEEPGO! If there is problem, they will not properly respond, they will just keep sending automated messages in delay..

https://www.facebook.com/KeepGo.Web2Go

comments.comment: What's the benefit of an eSim over a regular one since sim cards and plans are so easy to get here and hella cheap?

subcomments.subcomment: Anthony Jussila eSIMs allow you to have two SIMs on your phone simultaneously for one thing. Secondly an eSIM allows you travel freely from country to country and always connected without having to do anything - it switches service from one country to another automatically.Therefore I keep my Thailand SIM card in my phone always without ever having to remove it, but when I travel I switch on the eSIM. If I were to take a bus to Cambodia, then fly to Singapore, then on to Denmark for example, I would always be connected and never have to anything.
subsubcomments: Thomas Vagabond I already have two sims in my phone and they both work simultaneously just fine. But yeah makes sense if you travel that much to multiple different countries.

subcomments.subcomment: Anthony Jussila eSIM stands for “embed SIM” it’s a piece of hardware embed into your phone that can be programmed to receive the same data that is usually hardwired in a traditional SIM. It can be used as your main SIM or you can use it as a secondary SIM. It’s useful if you travel a lot so that you don’t have to switch out your usual SIM card and just buy a local plan that will be written inside your eSIM. Or you can buy international plans off the internet without needing to be shipped a physical SIM.

I know what it is though. Just didn't realize people have to swap around sim cards so much or that it's such a huge bother to do so. My last 3 phones have all had multiple sim card slots and I can just hotswap a new one in without even booting the phone in 15 seconds.
subsubcomments: Anthony Jussila You miss the point, you must buy new ones all the time. It is expense to buy a new SIM card each time enter a country, and highly inconvenient.
Thomas Vagabond Obviously I do miss the point since I've had the same Thai sim card in my 2nd slot for the past 2 years

Thomas Vagabond It really depends on your courier and the country.  I've been all over Asia with dtac sim and they always had a cheap roaming plan.  Same when I go to the US.  Go Global is 500b for 7 days and 83 countries.  Your time starts as soon as you land.

comments.comment: I have been meaning to switch my True SIM over to an eSIM, but every time I walk past a booth I realize I don't have my passport with me and you can't do anything in Thailand without your passport.

ADOPTION: 8 week old female kitten 🐱 

This gorgeous kitten (Seven) is looking for her forever home 🏡 

She had an eventful start to her life, being rescued from a car engine then getting sick with a deadly disease.

Thankfully, she had luck on her side and is now a fully healthy, playful and cuddly kitten who would make a wonderful pet 😻

She is great around other cats (she has even befriended my two unfriendly cats 😂) so she would thrive in a home with another feline. However, she is also pretty independent and happily plays on her own so would do well as a solo pet too.

She has been dewormed, deflead, and has had her first vaccination 💉

If your home is in need of some extra kitten love, please reach out to me via PM

comments.comment: Hi again Gemma, How is she going since 2June'23...... Maybe you were busy so did not update me. I said, I'm very willing, eagar and able to take her at mine, towards end of this month..... Absolutely no problem, provided of course she's stable, healthy and gaining weight, with vet book and copies of history and lab work so far. Everything being prepared to have her. 3 things, which I did not get the chance to tell you on our vid-call 2June :1- I delayed taking her, on about 1mth, as she was very fragile, and only out of hospital, 1 day post Parvo, at 7weeks well within the "failing kitty" period, especially considering her rough history. I've raised a few mini babas, with dropper/syringe/bottle for 10-12 weeks each, so know the deal. I've resuscitated kitties 3 times. 2- she received the next day, 3June, her vaccination, which does weaken the immune system initially, especially the multivalent Fellocell, which does contain min 3-5 different "diseases", same dose regardless if 600gm weight or 6kg...... So I considered it prudent to keep kitty close to vet who knows her already, your vet, also close to 24/7 help, and 3-: I also know well not to stress her out, (any cat/dog) even more all in one go, by changing human, house, environment, food, while dealing with recovery of living rough ordeal, of Parvo, parasite worm infestation, diarrhea/dehydration, + that vaccine while so very small. Her little body is trying now to detox all the medications and up-heaval Seven has required since 20May.                                              As I told you, I'd already organised a major house and surroundings "clean up" for June, lots of work, now full in swing.... In 2 weeks, if her immune system becomes and stays strong, kitty will have dealt with all the issues from late May early June, gained weight, be worm free, with no ill effects of that 1st vax. These are my reasons for delaying her adoption (per 2June) on max 4 weeks, now another 2weeks. These are very well medically considered, and personal reasons for delaying taking Seven kitty to my place.                    I've had the experience of nursing back to health, alone during the last 2 years, 3 dogs and 4 cats, all who became extremely sick, "immune deficiency syndromes", then picking up every disease/cancer around, due to living rough then massive medical intervention, and the meds/de-worm/anti tick/vax etc which over-loaded the already fragile natural immune system/liver/kidneys.....took months and months to heal those animals....... I do (sadly) know alot about this new disease process, humans but especially in our beloved cats/dogs.                                                  I year ago I cared for almost 100 animals alone daily, so the few I have now is easy........ no kids, no partner as distraction. Some may question behind my back my age........ age is a number and by no means represents HEALTH, energy, conviction, dedication. I challenge any to do a Pilates round with me, or hot foot it up and down then back up my 1st gear mountain top jungle track......I regularly donate blood....... just saying...... I've never in my life felt stronger and healthier........                                          Anyway, I've been awaiting any update post 1st vax, and general update, hopefully strengthening of baby Seven. Please advise, and rest assured, I'm committed to taking her, which I considered well for 14 days, before messaging/then calling you 2June.

subcomments.subcomment: I’ve already fabricated the handle for my cane. I’m on version 5/6. Version 5 has been “taped” together and has been functioning just fine for a couple of weeks now. I just finished version 6 and I’m quite sure it’s nearly perfect, so I’m trying to get the stuff ready so I can wrap the top in carbon to match the main support tube.
subsubcomments: Very cool. Sounds like it’ll be super strong. Is the resin for carbon fiber the same as fiberglass?
Bruno Araujo yes, I’m going to use epoxy resin. I’ve contacted Alpa Composites already.
It’s remarkable how much lighter the carbon version is. It felt weird at first, but now I can’t imagine going back to that wood club unless I need to for some reason.

subcomments.subcomment: Still gotta do some stuff to bling it out.  I really enjoyed the look of the waves in my wooden one, but I think I’ll do something more intricate with my 3d printer. I just haven’t figured out what yet.
subsubcomments: work of art!
Bruno Araujo thanks. A work of necessity, practicality, and spare time.  I have enjoyed the process, even though it’s been frustrating (learning CAD software) at times.

post_text: For those not aware there is a nasty virus sweeping through Phuket called Rota virus, i experienced it last night, vomiting 6 times, the 7th and 8th time was projectile vomiting the like i have never experienced before, with my stomach emptying in seconds. No sleep last night as i was going to the toilet every 5-10 minutes. Today completely lethargic, no appetite, struggling to get up and down my stairs. If for whatever reason you have stopped wearing a mask i would suggest you start doing so because this virus is highly contagious. I caught it from my granddaughter, who was also seriously ill.

comments.comment: Thanks for the post. Yes. Going around big time. So far not here but my wife and I have been ill all week. But not with that. Get well soon.

subcomments.subcomment: It is a nasty one, No warning just suddenly throwing up.
I told you John. That street food will get ya at some point. Now you are  sick.

comments.comment: Oh man, I think I may have it but no vomiting... Was up till half 5 on the toilet last night, stomach pains all day and exhausted

subcomments.subcomment: sounds like it.

comments.comment: Masks are pointless it's transmitted by poor sanitation. Wash your hands !

subcomments.subcomment: My granddaughter gave it to me nothing to do with sanitation.
subsubcomments: exactly so your hands......
I have read several reports that this can be transmitted by a cough or sneeze. My granddaughter is fastidious when it comes to washing her hands, raised in the Covid era.

subcomments.subcomment: While fecal-oral spread is most common, it’s possible to also get rotavirus by coming into any kind of contact with the bodily fluids of someone who has it, such as being sneezed on, or touching doorknobs or toys that have been touched by a child who has it.
subsubcomments: so wash your hands
wow, that is helpful.

comments.comment: Yes, thank you for the post. Important!
Many thanks for sharing Mervyn. Hope you recover soon.
We had it too, me and my son, rest and drink lots of water

They named their son Tyson, Mike Tyson, because he was such a fighter after surviving such a tough start to his life.

post_text:
ADOPTION: 7 week old female kitten 🐱 

Seven is one of the luckiest and toughest kittens I’ve ever come across 🍀💪

She was rescued from a car engine by Olga McDonald 2 weeks ago. Shortly after, she got sick and tested positive for parvo.

Miraculously, she made a full recovery in just a couple of days and is now fully healthy, happy, and ready to find her forever home 🏡

Seven is super playful with the perfect blend of affection and independence. She will happily play with her toys alone but as soon as you pick her up, she will be purring loudly in your arms and staring deeply into your eyes.

From getting rescued from a car engine to defeating a deadly disease, Seven has definitely had an eventful start to life.

She has had luck on her side up until now, but is now in need of some more to find her purrfect forever home 🤞

If you’re looking for a lucky charm, a cuddly companion, and a kitty with one hell of a fighting spirit, Seven is your girl! 

She has been dewormed, deflead, and will be getting her first vaccination tomorrow 💉

Please DM me if you are interested in adopting her 🙏

comments.comment: Update 06/06: Seven is still available for adoption

👉 We are looking for a Manager in our Beauty Salon in Phuket 🚩

Join our team as a Manager of our brand-new beauty salon, brought from overseas to Phuket. In this role, you will be responsible for managing and supervising the daily operations. 

RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Open the salon promptly at 10:30 am every day and ensure that it is ready for business.
• Close the salon at 7:30 pm, ensuring all necessary tasks are completed.
• Attend to the reception desk, warmly welcoming and assisting clients.
• Handle client payments and operate the cash register with accuracy and attention to detail.
• Prepare financial reports on a daily basis, maintaining meticulous records.
• Interact with clients, offering them refreshments such as coffee or tea.
• Develop and maintain a well-organized schedule for our team of professionals.
• Manage client appointments efficiently, ensuring smooth scheduling and minimize conflicts.
• Purchase necessary supplies for the salon, including napkins, water, gloves, coffee, tea, etc.
• Supervise the cleaning staff to maintain a clean and hygienic environment.
• Oversee laundry tasks, ensuring that towels and other items are cleaned and readily available.
• Fulfill any additional tasks assigned by the salon head to contribute to the salon's success.

REQUIRED SKILLS:
• Fluent in both English and Thai
• Proficient in using Excel or similar software to generate accurate financial reports.
• Friendly and open to talk to customers. 
• Previous experience in managing a salon or similar business is highly desirable.

WORKING CONDITIONS:
• You will be expected to work six days a week, from Monday to Saturday, with Sundays off.
•       Your working hours will be from 10:30 am to 7:30 pm.
• Your employment will commence on the 12th of June.

SALARY:
• From 20,000 Bath per month, can be more depending on professional skills.

🗨️🌺 Apply before June 8 by WhatsApp on Line 0815162448

The full Sunday roast line up is here…
🌟 Indulge in a Scrumptious Sunday Roast Feast! 🌟

Join us at Funquay this Sunday from 1pm until 8pm for a mouthwatering lineup of delectable roasts that will tantalize your taste buds. Our culinary team has crafted a menu that caters to all roast enthusiasts, offering a variety of delightful options to satisfy every craving. Here's a sneak peek into our glorious roast selection:

🍗 Chicken Roast: Succulent and juicy chicken breast, served with crispy roast potatoes, seasonal vegetables, and rich, flavorsome gravy. It's a classic that never fails to impress.

🥩 Beef Roast: Tender slices of beef, accompanied by golden roast potatoes, Yorkshire pudding, fresh veggies, and a luscious gravy. This roast will transport you to food heaven.

🐑 Roast Lamb: Experience the divine flavors of tender lamb, cooked to perfection, complemented by crispy roast potatoes, mint sauce, and a medley of seasonal vegetables. This roast is an absolute delight for lamb lovers.

🍽️ The Mini Roast: Perfect for those looking for a satisfying yet smaller portion, our Mini Roast includes succulent chicken, alongside roast potatoes, veggies, roast potatoes and mash with Yorkshire pudding. It's a mini feast that doesn't skimp on flavor.

🥩🍗🐑 The Grandaddy: For the ultimate roast experience, our Grandaddy is a magnificent combination of succulent lamb, chicken, and beef, accompanied by generous servings of roast potatoes, Yorkshire pudding, seasonal vegetables, and rich gravy. Prepare to be wowed!

🌽 Sweetcorn Roast (Vegetarian Option): Embrace the flavors of roasted sweetcorn, perfectly seasoned and served with a delightful array of vegetarian accompaniments, including roast potatoes, seasonal vegetables, and a vegetarian gravy. Vegetarian food never tasted this good!

✨ Don't miss out on this sensational Sunday Roast extravaganza! ✨

Join us at Funquay this Sunday from 1pm until 8pm to savor these delightful roasts and create unforgettable culinary memories. Bring your family and friends along for a delectable feast that will leave you craving more. Book your table now to secure your spot!

Importing a pet to Thailand can be a complicated process, but don't worry - we're here to help! At Siamese Freight, we have years of experience in pet relocation and can guide you through every step of the way.

First, it's important to understand the regulations and requirements ( http://www.dld.go.th/ ) for importing pets to Thailand. You'll need to have your pet's vaccinations up-to-date, obtain an import permit, and go through quarantine procedures upon arrival.

But with our expertise and attention to detail, we can make the process smooth and stress-free. We'll handle all the necessary paperwork, arrange transportation for your furry friend, and ensure they are safe and comfortable throughout the journey.

Plus, we offer additional services such as pet boarding and grooming for when you need to travel without your furry friend. So, if you're planning to import a pet to Thailand, trust Siamese Freight for a reliable and hassle-free experience.

Are there any places in phuket for decent shorefishing for barracuda or maybe jackfish?

comments.comment: Locals fish just past the Nai Harn Hotel. They've been fishing there for years. I never see them catch much tho. I go to a pier just north of the bridge pretty often, Natai Pier and there are always people fishing there. But the only thing I see them catch are squid and really small fish reef fish. Thais like to use these small fish like sergeant majors in curries, they like to dry them, and they also make ปลาร้า or fermented fish out of them, so they keep catching them. What's a jackfish? You mean trevally?

subcomments.subcomment: yes

comments.comment: You can get smaller specimens almost everywhere in phuket. The larger fish are a fair challenge to find though.

post_text: Has anyone recently renewed their US passport from the Embassy in Bangkok? If you have, can you please post your experience? For more than a decade it was a 1 day operation that can be done in person, but it looks like it can only be done by mail now? And it could take up to 5 to 6 WEEKS!?!! If you have done this recently, please post up your experience and let me know, especially if you did it by mail, and how long it took start to finish with new passport in hand. Thanks so much.

comments.comment: It appears, from other Expats experiences that it takes 5 to 6 weeks. The last renewal I did, I handed them my passport and paperwork, and the handed me he new PP late the next day.I spoke with a friend about his renewal 2 days ago. I advised him to photocopy every page and the 90 day reporting document so he would have some documentation, in the event it was lost.I still can't figure out how you pay the embassy the $130.00 fee.

subcomments.subcomment: You can pay it online now, and yes for the last 15 years I’ve walked into Bangkok embassy and done it in person same day, even going back to when they used to sew new pages into the book. Now it takes 5-6 WEEKS within a foreign country where that is your ID? Man I hope not.
subsubcomments: photo copy every page along with the 90 day reporting.

comments.comment: https://th.usembassy.gov/.../passports/adult-passport-renew/
Wife did it late last year. Posted to BKK. Received back post. About 3.5 weeks.
Renewed mine by mail. It was simple and the new passport arrived well before the estimated 5 weeks.

Young Husky looking for a nice family. Very active dogs so will need good outside space and good walks every day. Lovely thing

comments.comment: I don’t get the hype about huskies here. We rescued a husky from a house across my street alongside another husky and other dogs. Learn about the breeds before getting them. They might be pretty, but require a lot of attention and love

subcomments.subcomment: We have 3 dogs and each one requires a lot of attention and love, just like children.
subsubcomments: exactly. We have both a basenji and a husky as rescues, one thrown to the streets probably because the owner did not know what breed they had between their hands. The husky was tied to a pole 1 metrr long Leah, way sleep, poop in the same spot since she was 6 months. The amount of care they’ve both needed and training till this day is a lot, but would not change it for the world. Those bad owners don’t know what lovely dogs they threw out

comments.comment: As someone who's rescued 26 huskies in the Alaskan bush I'm going to get on my pedelestal for a minute:Stop bringing these animals to southeast Asia. These are animals designed to WORK in AUSTERE FREEZING CONDITIONS.A snowmachine can break down. It doesn't know the way home. GPS doesn't work well in -40 c . A husky works excellent. 100 KM a day pace for the Iditarod people. These animals have a higher v02 max than race horses (180 versus 220). I can leave them outside in -70. These are not meant to be pets. However they are fantastic with kids and cute. Pick an ideal breed for the climate ffs.

subcomments.subcomment: indeed but sadly they are here now so we have to do everything possible to find good homes for the many that get abandoned here. They are the most bred dog in thailand sadly

exactly!! And having a sledge dog is not is easy they can’t do what they’re meant to do in the heat. Half the day the ground is hotter than hell for them paws, and the rest after is dark. I wanted to find some way to build or find a substitute for a sledge to give her what she is built for, but not easy here
I 100% completely agree with you. That’s why I want to help this one that’s been disowned find the best place possible; for the dog’s sake.

comments.comment: Althea Pauya
Vin Royo

As said already, Huskies are energetic. As a result, they are escape artists. They will dig under a fence if they can't jump over it. They are lovely dogs, good with kids, but this is not the breed to leave at home, unsupervised, all day. I hope this dog finds a good fit.
Melissa Barrett
Oh so sad

post_text:
This Saturday!

♂️ Men's Peer Support Group Meeting in February

Open only for those who identify as male. Space is limited to 10 men per meeting. Meets once a month (future dates TBD).

The meeting is conducted in English and co-facilitated by Milla Budiarto, Founder of Phuket Men's Peer Support Group, and Kyle Daniels, Sport Psychologist and Life Coach at Coached Success.

-----------------------------------------

The men’s peer support group aims to create a safe, positive, and supportive environment for men who need to freely talk about their personal issues, experiences, and struggles without judgment. Privacy and confidentiality are at the core of the support group, “What you say in the room, stays in the room.”

We believe that by sharing experiences and exchanging coping strategies will allow the members to give and receive support from each other—creating a sense of belonging and validation, reducing feelings of isolation and loneliness, reducing the stigma associated with mental health challenges, enhancing coping skills, improving self-esteem, and increasing motivation and resilience.

-----------------------------------------

🗓️: Saturday, February 10

⏰: 10:30 am - 12:30 pm

📌: Safe Space Phuket, Phuket Town [https://goo.gl/maps/YXvZ7QAmaUALDQtEA](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fgoo.gl%2Fmaps%2FYXvZ7QAmaUALDQtEA%3Ffbclid%3DIwAR0Ej0G1c_biDty3nhqu8iEyEHnGJ4oxbifszuSq7uWKXAmbGkgEskxU4F8&h=AT2rHRxr2ytRusotDUvF3MGLlzHjV4W0wOLLRQg4zyT5DsZK2sSeMi233E6nF4DuaFd5Bqc0h3NsAGxCcAj0jH_75GWe3X0IyGIqD_pSsvRRn3oyqW01amH2efhZYZdZSj3f&__tn__=-UK-R&c[0]=AT18DYp8sjYehH3L6qqeMhoruzX_ODD4BvS53C0sLR8ukfkOdo8LvrDdwa_TkMYJm9AkgrWktfqBpvTtuTg012IE9GI83aDx00NEZpJJEiRSjHdF2NrJUI0f_v8OvrF235DHU7paSAxnGf2hyUwBt-IxZRviuNEcz-Blsl8)

post_text: Patong Beach, Phuket ❤

# **You Are Invited to Learn**

I am delighted to share this post to provide an update that will help you understand upcoming learning opportunities that will support you in your journey on The Path to Enlightenment.

**International Meditation & Buddhist Study Retreat (Chiang Mai, Thailand)**

You are invited to participate and learn at this upcoming retreat hosted in Chiang Mai, Thailand at Wat Tung Yu, a Theravada Buddhist Temple. From 20-25 August 2023, there will be an opportunity for you to come together with our international Community of Practitioners and Teachers.

This retreat will provide you the opportunity to more deeply learn and practice The Teachings of The Buddha while connecting with our international Community of Practitioners and Teachers. You will have the opportunity to visit the largest population of people who are practicing The Teachings of The Buddha - The Kingdom of Thailand, while having the opportunity to meet members of this international Community.

Not only will you have the opportunity to learn these Teachings and meet members of this international Community of Practitioners and Teachers but, you will be surrounded by millions of Buddhist Practitioners for you to be able to observe how a society of Buddhist Practitioners function on a daily basis.

This will excellerate and deeply enhance your understanding and practice of these Teachings.

Your understanding and practice of these Teachings will be significantly improved by visiting "the source" of these Teachings located in Chiang Mai, Thailand - The International Headquarters of Buddhist Teachings.

David Roylance will provide Teachings during this retreat in Thailand at no cost. This retreat is offered openly and freely to "all beings".

You can find all the details using this link. Perhaps I will see you in Thailand.

**Learn more:** https://www.buddhadailywisdom.com/2023-retreat-cm

**LOW SEASON PROMOTION**

**PRIVATE CHARTER TO CORAL ISLAND – ~~WAS 18,000THB~~ – NOW 14,000THB**

(1-10 pax)

*Valid: 15 May – 15 June 2023*

A private boat charter is a fantastic way to explore Phuket's beautiful islands during the low season. Low season is an ideal time to plan your trip, the weather is generally mild, and there are fewer crowds, which means you'll have a more relaxed and enjoyable experience.

Explore Coral Island an exquisite tropical paradise that boasts crystal clear waters, white sandy beaches, and an array of exciting activities that are sure to leave you with unforgettable memories.

Imagine yourself basking in the warm sun, sipping on a refreshing drink and enjoying the stunning views of the Andaman Sea. Whether you want to relax and unwind or seek adventure, Coral Island has something for everyone.

Take a dip in the turquoise waters and explore the colourful coral reefs while snorkeling or scuba diving. You can also enjoy a thrilling banana boat ride or parasailing adventure, and feel the adrenaline rush through your veins.

So what are you waiting for? Book your private charter today and join us in paradise for an experience you will never forget.

**Call, WhatsApp or Line:**+66620505778 / +66620507028

🇫🇷🌴 Calling all expats in Phuket! 🌍📚

Are you looking for an exciting new language adventure for yourself or your children? Look no further than [Alliance Française de Phuket](https://www.facebook.com/AlliancefrancaisePhuket?__cft__[0]=AZUm66H0ppOUBtx7-rhPETKbFeomrhCa-a5_kIATOKcidKHbFY-v3ZIm7FZoLq1NMi43OeHsNWpFyw0MvkGPtjiIEIHlr7dEtIWWV_6oTQZqcIWqkTuMyzwX-OVUcnXjqQWQyebJF4Asqy6gHibHStMIRiBGmvXRLdGY0lu9_CZiU4sv_A4IuvU7DlUp0cd0haM&__tn__=-]K-R)! 🎉🇫🇷

Bonjour, everyone! We're thrilled to announce that [Alliance Française de Phuket](https://www.facebook.com/AlliancefrancaisePhuket?__cft__[0]=AZUm66H0ppOUBtx7-rhPETKbFeomrhCa-a5_kIATOKcidKHbFY-v3ZIm7FZoLq1NMi43OeHsNWpFyw0MvkGPtjiIEIHlr7dEtIWWV_6oTQZqcIWqkTuMyzwX-OVUcnXjqQWQyebJF4Asqy6gHibHStMIRiBGmvXRLdGY0lu9_CZiU4sv_A4IuvU7DlUp0cd0haM&__tn__=-]K-R) is now offering top-notch French language lessons tailored specifically for our vibrant expat community on this beautiful island. Whether you're a working professional, a retiree, or a parent seeking an enriching experience for your little ones, we have something special in store for you! 🎓💼👨‍👩‍👧‍👦

Why French, you may ask? Well, the benefits are endless! 🌟 French is not just the language of love and romance, but it also opens up a world of opportunities. Here are a few reasons why learning French with Alliance Française Phuket is the perfect choice:

🔹 Cultural Enrichment: Immerse yourself in the fascinating French culture, art, literature, and cinema. From iconic landmarks like the Eiffel Tower to mouthwatering cuisine, the French way of life is waiting to be discovered!

🔹 Career Boost: French is spoken by millions of people worldwide and is an official language in over 29 countries. Expand your professional horizons and gain a competitive edge in various industries, including tourism, hospitality, international relations, and more.

🔹 Academic Excellence: Give your children the gift of bilingualism! Learning French at a young age enhances cognitive development, improves problem-solving skills, and paves the way for future academic achievements.

At Alliance Française Phuket, we pride ourselves on our team of highly qualified and dedicated teachers who create a dynamic and interactive learning environment. Our courses cater to all levels, from complete beginners to advanced learners, ensuring personalized attention and rapid progress. 🌟📖✏️

So, why wait any longer? Start your French language journey with us today and unlock a world of possibilities! 😍🗺️

To learn more about our course offerings and registration details, visit our website https://afphuket.wixsite.com/afphuket/en or contact us! Don't miss out on this incredible opportunity to embrace the French language and culture right here in Phuket!

À bientôt! 🇫🇷❤️

#alliancefrançaisephuket #learnfrench #phuket #francophonie

Writing on behalf of an expat neighbour who is not in this group. She’s wondering about the legality of her rental contract and if she has any recourse she can take that’s not “move out and find another place”. She has never spoken to or met the owner of her condo. The contract was drafted by our condo management company (one of the big ones here) and she also pays rent to their account. The signature on the contract is the signature of the owner (allegedly), who is Japanese based on his name, but she has no other information about him apart from that, and has no way to contact him directly. The contract only includes a photo of her passport, but not the owner’s. When she asks the management company to have a copy of the owner’s passport, they refuse to give it to her, citing data privacy and that they never ever share owner details with tenants.
Can she legally demand the owner information from the management company? And the owner’s contact details so she can speak with him directly? She’s frustrated because the condo has not been maintained for years, and the owner is not responding to any requests for repairs or replacements (big things, not small things she can do herself) that the management company forwards to the owner. They claim they asked the owner 6 months ago, without a reply, but don’t seem bothered enough to push the owner. At this stage, it’s not even clear that the owner is who they say he is, as they refuse to give her any information than a name written on a piece of paper.
I have rented 3 times in Thailand and all 3 contracts have included the passport of the tenant and the landlord/owner and contact details of the owner, and we have been indirect contact with them about everything, so based on my experience this doesn’t seem right at all.
She doesn’t want to leave, because the price is good and the place is close to her office. And it’s not easy to find reasonably priced rentals in Phuket right now.

comments.comment: Simply move out leave the headache behind

subcomments.subcomment: not the answer to my question, but thanks. She knows she can move on, that was in the first paragraph, but that wasn't the question, whether she should move on.
subsubcomments: Agent is giving her the run around, Owner lost in space, Agent probably doesn't k ow the owner and just acquired the keys, might explain why nothing been done

comments.comment: don't kick the hornets nest

OK I’m confused.Is your friend Thai or an expat living here?If an expat, then how does your friend lodge rental details for their address notifications or yearly visa extensions? As both of these require details of the owner of the rental property to be shown.

subsubcomments: Thanks, I didn’t know that.I’ve rented, but never condos.

comments.comment: I would guess the owner is aware of the need for repairs and maintenance but has chosen to ignore the requests from the tenant/management company. A common attitude here from absentee landlords that hope that you will fix the problem or get tired of complaining.When I rented out some apartments my name did not appear on the rental contract that was between the tenant and the management company that I employed as a buffer between me and the tenant.They can approach a lawyer to look at the landlord’s responsibilities in the contract and get them to write a legal letter and try to get some response but this will be time consuming and expensive. Two real options, stop paying the rent and see what happens for as long it takes to use up any deposit you have given and then vote with your feet or put up with the problem.
The owner decided to use a management company to deal with tenants. You have no right to communicate directly with the owner.

Make a list of what urgently needs fixing and refuse to pay rent until it's done. Write this formally and in triplicate at least 1 for you, 1 for agent (get signature ) and 1 for landlord (name should be on rental agreement if they're holding a registered bond from you. Date your request and allow for a witness to your and the agents signatures. Explain that you have been a tolerant tenant,but it's time for action now. And request a receipt from the owners to confirm when work will be done.  Also give contact details and a WhatsApp phone number.  good luck.

subcomments.subcomment: in a normal world dealing with normal management people, your advise would possibly make sense. Given the information that was divulged all ready by the tenant, it does not appear they give a S#!T I'd be gone at the end of the month. There is great availability for rentals at the present time.

this sounds for some countries like a good idea. But not paying the rental can also lead to a immediatly cancellation of the rental contract and they can even use the police to force somebody to leave the place.With a managment company that looks like they don't care too much and a owner, same, same this could be a easy solution for a complaining customer.The legal way would be an civil court case, what just will take years. And there it is also the question what is in the contract.Leaving and look for a place where you know the owner and know there is somebody who care would maybe the better solution.

comments.comment: Common situation in Thailand. No one will provide owner details and you need to deal with management company. Price can be low because of condition of condo.

The rental contract must include the address of both parties. But it can be a company that own the Condo, like many foreigner do it. In this case the managing director of the company is official the person to talk to. If the address is missing, the contract is the paper not worth.At the Land Department you can also get the owner of the Condo and if there is a long term leasing contract. Because some foreigner lease a object over 30 years with option. Contracts over 3 years must be there also registered.If the owner is a company, you can get from the DBD the registration with the managing director and a shareholder list.The problem is, all this hassle don't fix her anything. She could now make a civil court case what takes years and costs at first money for the Lawyer.Especially after it's pretty clear that the owner and the management company don't care and maybe they would be happy if the contract ends, because the rental is reasonable.Practical means this she can think if the rental is that cheap that she better let it fix on her own costs, or live with this or search for another place. But this are just my 2 cents.

Red flags. It's possible the place is being rented without the owner's knowledge. A friend of mine turned up in Phuket once to make use of HIS OWN empty condo only to find someone had been living /renting it for 4 months. The agent had 'forgotten' to tell him.

Normally the owner name is on the contract. Even it is stated in the contract that the landlord is required to fix things and you can do it and even with hold money from the rent, when rent is up you are out. You mentioned it yourself the rent is a great deal, so she should either stay with the current conditions or move out. She just does not have a choice.
Stop paying rent.  Good chance you've already lost your deposit anyway, so what's the harm?

Nothing you can do with landlords, going to a court will cost money and it'll be a waste of time and money at the end. I had my rental contract end 7 months early, I talked to a lawyer about it and she just said you're just lucky to get your full deposit back. This isn't back home, nothing worthwhile you can do, if she needs something fixed she should do the math on cost of moving to another area or paying to fix it herself if owner doesn't want to fix it. However if she lets say takes it out of the months rental price the owner can hire some goons to kick her out of the place if they get pissed off. IMO buying property here is a bad idea, condos even though the owners pay a yearly fee to management tend to age quick and maintenance seriously lacks, after 5 years condo complexes don't look nice and after 10 they usually look like shit. But at least you won't have to deal with a shitty landlord again. You really have no real power here, I rented a condo once and they billed me 17,000 for cleaning fee .

subcomments.subcomment: I am a retired American lawyer.  I don't know anything about Thai law

If I had this problem in america I would file a  civil  lawsuit against the management company and then quickly use civil procedures such as subpoeing the management co records that would show who the owner is.  Alternatively, there is something called a Request for Production by which you could finally request those records.  Also, in america you could take a deposition of a management person under oath and inquire about the owner
I would suggest you visit with a Thai real estate or landlord tenant attorney to get direction if u r committed to staying where u r.
subsubcomments: Also, in America u would visit the place where property deeds are filed or recorded.   The deed must be in an owners name, not a management companys name.
So by visiting you  could you would get the info you seek
If you filed a lawsuit in america under these circumstances, you would deposit  the  monthly rent into the courts registry where it would be held until the case was resolved

So, you put pressure on the owner to do something since he or she isn't receiving rent, yet you protect yourself from being evicted as you are paying rent, just not to the owner or the management company

post_text:
# **Foundation in The Path to Enlightenment - Meditation Practitioner Course (30-hours)
(7-11 August 2023)**

This course focuses on guiding Students in developing a solid foundation in The Teachings and practices of Gotama Buddha.

Students will learn how to establish a “life practice” based on independent observation of Gotama Buddha’s Teachings. Students will be guided in how to acquire wisdom through learning and practicing The Teachings to liberate the mind on The Path to attaining Enlightenment.

At the conclusion of this course, Students will have a theoretical foundation to start integrating and applying these Teachings in daily life to include a consistent meditation practice to eliminate discontent feelings from the mind such as sadness, anger, frustration, irritation, annoyance, guilt, shame, fears, boredom, loneliness, shyness, jealousy, resentment, stress, anxiety, etc.

**Teachings & Discussions (Dhamma Talks)**

- Life Story of Gotama Buddha

- Enlightenment: What is “Enlightenment”?

- The Four Noble Truths: Establishing Right View

- The Eight Fold Path: The Path for All Humans to Enlightenment

- Transforming The Three Poisons: Craving, Anger, and Ignorance

- The Five Precepts: A Householder's Guide to Daily Practice

- What is Kamma and How Does It Affect Me?

- What is Merit?

- Meditation: Developing Your Practice

- Buddhist Temple Tour

**Meditation Practice**

- Meditation Instruction: Breathing Mindfulness Meditation

- Meditation Positions: Seated, Lying, Standing, and Walking Position

- Buddhist Chanting in Pali

(There are no prerequisites for this course. Offered openly and freely to “all beings” at no cost.)

**Learn More:** [https://www.buddhadailywisdom.com/courses-retreats-in-chiang-mai-thai](https://www.buddhadailywisdom.com/courses-retreats-in-chiang-mai-thai)

——-

**Daily Wisdom - Walking The Path with The Buddha**

Dedicated to the education of Gotama Buddha's Teachings to attain Enlightenment.

[https://www.BuddhaDailyWisdom.com](https://www.buddhadailywisdom.com/?fbclid=IwAR285q767dsm-422xqZEEE9TYWmkl1Z97ensRXZiGhQKex5q7rKzI41mfiE)

(See our website for online learning, courses, and retreats.)

----------

**David Roylance** is a dedicated Practitioner and Teacher of Gotama Buddha’s Teachings who has been part of the Thai community since 2001. He visited Thailand for the first time in 2002 and brought the Traditional Thai Healing Arts back to the United States of America to share with people in the Western World.

His Traditional Thai Healing Arts centers, located in the Washington DC area, provided traditional Thai healing arts to clients and educational opportunities to Students to explore the Thai healing arts, Thai culture, and The Teachings of Gotama Buddha. David is a published author with books on the topics of Traditional Thai Healing Arts and The Path That Leads to Enlightenment.

David has taught Gotama Buddha’s Teachings since 2005 in the United States of America. In 2015, he closed his businesses and relocated to Chiang Mai, Thailand to be closer to the Thai culture and the Thai Community of Buddhist Practitioners.

David shares Gotama Buddha’s Teachings with Household Practitioners and Ordained Practitioners in Chiang Mai, Thailand and around the world through courses, retreats, and special events providing guidance to help people attain Enlightenment - a peaceful, calm, serene, and content mind with joy.

***What are tar balls, and how do they form?***

Tar balls, the little, dark-colored pieces of oil that can sometimes stick to your feet when you go to the beach, are often remnants of oil spills but can also be produced from [natural seeps](https://response.restoration.noaa.gov/oil-and-chemical-spills/oil-spills/resources/what-are-natural-oil-seeps.html), places where oil slowly escapes from the earth surface above some petroleum reservoirs. Tar balls that appear on central California shores during the winter months often originate from southern California seeps on the seafloor.

When crude oil (or a heavier refined product) floats on the ocean surface, its physical characteristics change. During the first few hours of a spill, the oil spreads into a thin slick. Winds and waves tear the slick into smaller patches that are scattered over a much wider area. Various physical, chemical, and biological processes change the appearance of the oil. These processes are generally called "[weathering](https://response.restoration.noaa.gov/oil-and-chemical-spills/significant-incidents/exxon-valdez-oil-spill/what-weathering.html)."

Initially, the lighter components of the oil evaporate much like a small gasoline or diesel spill. In the cases of heavier types of oil, such as crude oil or home heating oil, much of the oil remains behind. At the same time, some crude oils mix with water to form an emulsion that often looks like chocolate pudding. This emulsion is much thicker and stickier than the original oil. Winds and waves continue to stretch and tear the oil patches into smaller pieces, or tar balls. While some tar balls may be as large as pancakes, most are coin-sized. Tar balls are very persistent in the marine environment and can travel hundreds of miles.

So some explanation behind the photos:

Firstly a huge thank you to Domonic and shampu, they worked so hard to clean up our untouched for two years garden!

The mould and ground dirt finally got to me, and after seeing the walls in the garden at Simone's house, I found out about Dominic at https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=61556512049974(Mr Catz Power Wash) or phone:062 001 4296. A new small venture offering the service we all would love to have!

So I booked Dominic, and he came round for a quote and returned the next day on time to start the big job of cleaning the rear walls and floor of my rental garden. Dominic takes care to discuss with you all your requirements and completes the task as requested.

In blistering sun(morning) and hotter temps than any of us would like he and Shampu did a fantastic job. All I can say is if your looking for a reliable/punctual/affordable power jet cleaning service, Dominic is the one I would definitely recommend.

And from every job he completes and is paid for a % donation will go to a local cat charity (RAL rescue in Rawai).

I have posted the photos below of before and after and a short video to show how thorough the cleaning process is, even though you think they are clean (the walls and floors) They are not lol

Give Dominic a call/message today! and not only help a new small business but all your furry friends on the streets!

Thank you, Dominic, and Shampu!

# **Foundation in The Path to Enlightenment - Meditation Practitioner Course (30-hours)
(3-7 July 2023)**

This course focuses on guiding Students in developing a solid foundation in The Teachings and practices of Gotama Buddha.

Students will learn how to establish a “life practice” based on independent observation of Gotama Buddha’s Teachings. Students will be guided in how to acquire wisdom through learning and practicing The Teachings to liberate the mind on The Path to attaining Enlightenment.

At the conclusion of this course, Students will have a theoretical foundation to start integrating and applying these Teachings in daily life to include a consistent meditation practice to eliminate discontent feelings from the mind such as sadness, anger, frustration, irritation, annoyance, guilt, shame, fears, boredom, loneliness, shyness, jealousy, resentment, stress, anxiety, etc.

**Teachings & Discussions (Dhamma Talks)**

- Life Story of Gotama Buddha

- Enlightenment: What is “Enlightenment”?

- The Four Noble Truths: Establishing Right View

- The Eight Fold Path: The Path for All Humans to Enlightenment

- Transforming The Three Poisons: Craving, Anger, and Ignorance

- The Five Precepts: A Householder's Guide to Daily Practice

- What is Kamma and How Does It Affect Me?

- What is Merit?

- Meditation: Developing Your Practice

- Buddhist Temple Tour

**Meditation Practice**

- Meditation Instruction: Breathing Mindfulness Meditation

- Meditation Positions: Seated, Lying, Standing, and Walking Position

- Buddhist Chanting in Pali

(There are no prerequisites for this course. Offered openly and freely to “all beings” at no cost.)

**Learn More:** [https://www.buddhadailywisdom.com/courses-retreats-in-chiang-mai-thai](https://www.buddhadailywisdom.com/courses-retreats-in-chiang-mai-thai)

——-

**Daily Wisdom - Walking The Path with The Buddha**

Dedicated to the education of Gotama Buddha's Teachings to attain Enlightenment.

[https://www.BuddhaDailyWisdom.com](https://www.buddhadailywisdom.com/?fbclid=IwAR285q767dsm-422xqZEEE9TYWmkl1Z97ensRXZiGhQKex5q7rKzI41mfiE)

(See our website for online learning, courses, and retreats.)

----------

**David Roylance** is a dedicated Practitioner and Teacher of Gotama Buddha’s Teachings who has been part of the Thai community since 2001. He visited Thailand for the first time in 2002 and brought the Traditional Thai Healing Arts back to the United States of America to share with people in the Western World.

His Traditional Thai Healing Arts centers, located in the Washington DC area, provided traditional Thai healing arts to clients and educational opportunities to Students to explore the Thai healing arts, Thai culture, and The Teachings of Gotama Buddha. David is a published author with books on the topics of Traditional Thai Healing Arts and The Path That Leads to Enlightenment.

David has taught Gotama Buddha’s Teachings since 2005 in the United States of America. In 2015, he closed his businesses and relocated to Chiang Mai, Thailand to be closer to the Thai culture and the Thai Community of Buddhist Practitioners.

David shares Gotama Buddha’s Teachings with Household Practitioners and Ordained Practitioners in Chiang Mai, Thailand and around the world through courses, retreats, and special events providing guidance to help people attain Enlightenment - a peaceful, calm, serene, and content mind with joy.

post_text:
# **Hey Phuket Peeps**

I have noticed a few Phuket Facebook Chats and WhatApp Groups going around. It's nice to see people getting us together, arranging meet-ups and organizing events again. But it gets a bit much when you get 200+ people in a single WhatsApp group. 3 people talk about something random, and it pings the entire group. Like most people, I end up muting these groups, and when I go back to check, I have to scroll down what feels like 17km of chat to see if I missed anything.

There is a solution I would like us all to try, though, and that is Discord. It's an app similar to FB Messager and WhatsApp, but instead of a singular channel, it's a multi-channel platform with many channels based around different subjects. These channels are also based on the interests you select, so you will only see the channel if you are not interested in that subject. @everyone
## **Click here to join the PHUKET Discord: [https://www.discord.gg/BxAFRBc](https://www.discord.gg/BxAFRBc?fbclid=IwAR02P1spP9zAMn0s1pzwWmcG0VnqOx1zXI_3v8R7C0WIjQaX5Urt8cfIulc)**

I also added an AI bot to Discord called "Pad Thai". 😂 It can answer questions people might have and a ticket support system. I would like to see how it evolves. I will also be arranging some meet-ups there, so let me know if you have any suggestions.

**Seeking Insights: Flexible Thailand Itinerary with a Kid**

Hi everyone, we're heading to Thailand from the end of February to mid-March to explore potential new homes for our family. Our flights to and from Thailand are booked, but we're keeping our in-country itinerary flexible.    Here's our tentative plan, and I'd appreciate any advice or suggestions:
* **Bangkok (3 Nights)**: We'll be staying in the Sukhumvit area. Any family-friendly activities or specific spots in Sukhumvit you'd recommend for a family with a kid?
* **Hua Hin (3-4 Nights)**: Drawn to its expat community but mindful of the air quality in March. Any alternative activity suggestions or local advice?
* **Phuket (8 Nights)**: Seeking a calm area suitable for families and conducive to remote work, away from the Patong area. Which places would you recommend?
* **Krabi (8 Nights)**: Looking for recommendations on peaceful, family-friendly places to stay.
* **Back to Bangkok (1 Night)**: Before the flight.

We're saving Northern Thailand for a later visit. What would you add or change in our itinerary?

Thanks a lot for your help!

post_text:
Dear Phuket expats,

First of all, forgive me for this lengthy post. A request for your valuable input as I embark on an exciting new venture in Phuket. My business, named "Eve," focuses on short-term leasing of electric motorbikes (Niu) and electric cars (Tesla), (short lease = rental for a month or longer).

Having moved to Phuket two years ago, I am deeply passionate about making a positive impact on the environment and our community by promoting electric vehicles (EVs). I understand that EVs are still relatively expensive for many local residents, which is why I have initially targeted expats as our primary customer base. However, my long-term vision includes encouraging locals, especially motorbike users, to transition to EVs.

Many of you have deep roots in Phuket, and I value your opinions immensely. Specifically, I would appreciate your insights on the following:

**Electric Motorbikes:** Electric cars from brands like BYD, MG, Haval, and Tesla are gaining popularity on Phuket's roads, yet electric motorbikes, despite their easy charging and cost-effective fuel savings, remain rare, even among expats and tourists. Why do you think electric motorbikes are adopted more slowly than cars, and what can be done to encourage their use?

**Reaching New Families:** We aim to connect with individuals and families either before or shortly after their arrival in Phuket. However, over time, priorities change, leading them to rent vehicles from other sources. While we engage with real estate brokers and participate in expat communities on social media, can you recommend alternative ways to reach relocating families in Phuket?

I understand that there may be skepticism surrounding EVs, and I welcome your candid opinions as they help me to improve my concept.

Thank you in advance for taking the time to share your insights.

Warm regards, Nick

PS: If you want to get a better sense of what we do, then take a look at www.ev-eve.com

comments.comment: EVs are becoming very affordable for Thais as an alternative to ICE vehicles. Maybe not Euro brands, but Neta V is dirt cheap and I see them all driven by Thais. I'm an EV owner so I get it. Good luck to you.The electric motorbikes are much more expensive compared to their petrol counterparts. Even brands like Vespa and Harley Davidson make electric models but don't sell them in the Thai market.

subcomments.subcomment: That is a very valuable insight Neil. Thank you. And do you have any idea why expats aren't switching to EV motorbikes?
subsubcomments: lack of availability maybe? I would buy a Livewire if HD would bring it here.
That is an awesome bike indeed:)
yeah the new S2 Del Mar is really nice looking. Maybe someday.

I'll tell you why expats aren't switching to EV motorbikes. It's cost. Several years ago in Phuket I bought a used Honda  motorcycle for 5,000 baht. It worked perfectly and I used it almost every day for 3 years without any problems whatsoever and then I sold it for 6,000 baht. Best transportation deal ever. There is a plentiful and cheap supply of used motorbikes and it's also quite cheap to rent. The cost of a decent EV bike can't compete with that. Since leaving Phuket I'm currently living in a small rural village in Isaan and I was surprised to notice a lot of the local Thais riding cheap electric bikes that you can order from Lazada for 15,000 baht. Nothing to get very excited about, but you can get something quite reasonable for 30,000 baht as a local runaround bike. But if you were to compare the price of an EV that had the same kind of quality as a 50,000 baht Honda Wave you would be looking at around 150,000 Baht for the equivalent EV bike. I think it's a difficult market to break into. I'm sure it will get going eventually as long as we avoid the cheap bikes with batteries that are continually catching fire in China. I say this is an EV enthusiast who is considering buying an EV car.

subcomments.subcomment: Those are all amazing, but pretty heavy bikes. My first goal is to encourage expats to swap their Clicks, Scoopies, Filano's etc. for (small) electric bikes like the Niu Gova, Niu Nqi Sport and Niu NQi GTS.
subsubcomments: how are those Niu bikes? We have 2 Vespas and I wouldn't want underpowered motorbikes.
Hi Neil, the Niu NQi GTS bikes can definitely compete with your Vespas. You're welcome to come over and try a GTS for free for a few days.

comments.comment: All of these vehicles have one thing in common. They are all just "transportation". I worked in the luxury auto business for several years in the US.We used our cars for long trips and used them to get to the commuter train stations as well. In Thailand, I only need transportation and have rented the same Honda Jazz for 10 years. It's a great little hatch back and it is very reliable. We don't need anything more.
Lack or reliable electricity supply especially in rainy season, and not sure I would fancy riding an electric bike through the flooded streets

subcomments.subcomment: Hi Martin, a hiccup in the power supply doesn't have an impact on charging your bike. It might just take a little longer. Rain is a commonly heard reason for not riding electric, which I understand. You should indeed avoid riding in puddles or standing water, as this can damage the electronics on your bike.
subsubcomments: I wouldn’t call half day blackouts as “hiccups”, if you can’t charge your bike you can’t ride it. If you have a power cut in your area you can still ride your scooter to a Petrol station nearby and fill it up - or use a local “whisky bottle” Petrol shop. Plus how many condos / rooms have bike charging facilities? Probably none. Compare that to a cheap honda click which will last for years, can be bought for a few thousand per month and sips cheap petrol.Why on earth would you want the inconvenience of an electric bike?

Valid points once again, Matthew. However, I have a few counterarguments: I live in Laguna, where we hardly experience any blackouts. Before I go to bed, I habitually charge my phone, toothbrush, and bike.Furthermore, there's a strong focus on the environmental aspect, which is commendable. Perhaps I'm growing older, but I'm not a fan of the sound of a combustion bike, let alone the sound of ten of them or a tuned motorbike. Just imagine waiting at a red light without all these sounds around you, and not having to inhale the exhaust gases from the car or bike in front of you...

with the greatest respect, as an expat living in Laguna you probably have no concept of the average expat or thai living in phuket town / Patong / karon / rawai in a condo with no charging facilities. Power outages are a regular occurrence across the country, especially in the rainy season.You might need to come down from your lofty position and see how the main population live in the island.With no infrastructure, expensive prices, unknown resale value and reliability plus the very questionable way in which the batteries are made - I can’t see any reason to get people off their clicks and onto an electric bike any time soon.Plus of course that the young kids LOVE making as much noise as possible - that’s why so many bikes have straight through pipes on them….. why would they want to whisper about when their scooters can rattle windows at 100 metres !

Haha, you're right about the young kids. Of course, they love to make noise. That doesn't necessarily mean that others enjoy it:)And don't worry, I love touring on my bike all over the island, so I've been just about everywhere. In fact, we have quite a few young digital nomads living in the south who lease our bikes. But I'm aware that Laguna is not representative of Phuket

Is it really that bad in Phuket Town ? I know there are power outages in rainy season but they're usually brief, a few hours at most. I don't see how they would seriously impact charging a bike. You regularly have multi day blackouts there?

I said “half a day” which is “a few hours at most” as you say as well.The point being if your bike battery is flat you are stuck.If your petrol bike is out of gas you can go to a whisky bottle shop and buy some.The real issue though is where would you even charge it? If you live in a huge villa in Laguna then that fine but for the thousands of people in condos you have no chance.

Hi Matthew, you can simply remove the battery from your bike and charge it in your condo. Depending on how often you use your bike and the type of bike, you may need to do this once or twice a week. I always do it at night so that I have a full battery in the morning.
Also, We provide you with an app that precisely displays your battery percentage and the remaining range.
I can just see thai ladies lugging a heavy battery up to the condo ….. brilliant.At the end of the day the infrastructure is not in place yet.

comments.comment: Q1 - electric cars are becoming popular because they allow Thais (or people who've become assimilated into the materialistic aspect of Thai culture) to pretend they're richer than they are - i.e. Teslas are less than half the price of equivalent Mercedes / BMWs / Audis because of the tax break - there isn't the same value arbitrage with electric mopeds so you'd have to either find a way to make them cheaper or promote them as being more upmarket (almost impossible, hence I recommend you forget about trying to convert locals and just focus on tourists for the mopeds)Q2 - buy Google ads with all English language keywords related to buying / renting cars in Phuket / Thailand, then retarget anyone who clicks the Google ad with ads in Facebook / IG / YouTube / etc (presumably in the same way you will do with anyone who clicks the link in this post) - if you have enough budget, you should do the same in Russian and Chinese (using Baidu and WeChat for the latter too) - for the long-term lease of the Teslas (which is honestly the most attractive/ unique offer you have), you could also promote in Thai language and focus more on Bangkok, which is much bigger market

subcomments.subcomment: Hi Oliver, Your input is highly valuable, particularly regarding arbitrage.Regarding marketing, in my previous experiences with other companies, we allocated a significant budget to marketing efforts. This time around, I'm eager to explore how far I can progress without relying on platforms such as Google and Facebook. However, it's possible that they are indispensable, and establishing a company without their assistance could result in significantly slower growth.

comments.comment: So basically its an advert then...

subcomments.subcomment: and not a very convincing one!

comments.comment: The electric motorcycles with sufficient power and range don't have removable batteries. The motorcycles with removable batteries, don't have enough range and power for Phuket's hills.Therefore, they are not an option for people living in condos or apartments. Most who live in condos or apartments don't have access to an electrical outlet where they park.

subcomments.subcomment: Hi Keith, it depends on what your definition of 'sufficient' is. The Niu NQi GTS has a maximum range of 110 km, and its top speed is 80 km/h. This bike has two removable batteries and can easily climb the hills in Phuket.
subsubcomments: you're right. However, that one is nearly 130k.

That is correct, Keith. We lease this bike for THB 8,000 per month. Keep in mind that if someone uses a motorbike like this, they will likely spend between THB 1,500 to THB 2,000 on fuel per month, whereas charging the GTS only costs 13 THB. So, all in all, the monthly lease price of this bike is similar to leasing a Honda ADV 160, for example.

, so you are comparing one charging of EV to month usage of conventional bike? PCX can be rented for long term around 2000/month, maybe that explains why 8000/month is not so good option for many, as you get smaller bike with much higher cost. If PCX brakes down, there are hundreds of shops in the island to fix it.Also one thing that is bad with EVs, they don't make noise (don't know if that mode has some noise generator for low speeds) and being silent makes you more prone to be run over by some vehicle or run under by some animal. Phuket and Bangkok would be last of the places for me to drive with something that doesn't protect me in case of crash and that is silent.

Hi Tatu, Most people who are considering riding an electric motorbike compare costs. Therefore, I have shared this cost comparison. The rental price for a Honda PCX for a month or more is approximately THB 9,000 per month. You can find more details here: https://enigmarentals.com/rent-a-honda-adv-160cc/ And you are correct, Niu bike parts usually need to be sourced from Bangkok, which typically takes a few days.
, 9000/month? That’s crazy high, even for short 2-3 months rentals I have never paid over 4000/month.For cost comparison, my point was, that 14 thb does not equal to the mentioned 1500-2000 thb.
That is correct Tatu. When you would charge your bike every day, you'd spend 30 * THB 14 = THB 420 vs THB 1500-2000

comments.comment: Serviceability, and charging. My neighbor in bang tao imported a Tesla model x. Which ran him over 11m baht, and no one will service it as promised. All the other brands have very limited range- so people just figure to fill up their tank and get 600km. Got to stop pushing the eco friendly side of EV, and focus more on the convenience and added luxuries inside. As they aren’t very eco friendly.  Good luck with the new venture.

subcomments.subcomment: Thank you, Matthew. Those are valid points. This is the reason why we chose Tesla. The official range of the Model 3 is over 350km. Since everyone will use the AC, the range is reduced to around 300km. For an island like Phuket, this is sufficient for most families.The fact that Tesla does not have a service point outside of BKK is definitely something to consider.
