subsubcomments: there’s like 12 teslas in Thailand. From an import perspective you’ll spend around $200,000+ on one after import and fees. Range aside, getting the funding to offer them for rent and finding an insurance provider allowing the same will be the mission.  There is no way to structure this business with teslas in Thailand where money would be made. EV ownership turns into a nightmare when there is lack of charging stations, and service spots. Then you just have a paperweight. Teslas use oil too, for the gear reduction and differential and cooling. They have a filter and everything. If you want to be passionate for the environment plant trees, and restore marine habitats. When people add that they are passionate for EV it usually collides with them saying so just for profit.

Hi Matthew, Teslas don't need to be imported anymore, as of a few months ago. The Tesla Model 3 starts at THB 1.8 million. Our Teslas are insured by Virayah, one of Thailand's largest car insurance companies.Additionally, setting up your own charging station at home is quite easy. I've coordinated several installations for customers, and they all went smoothly.

subcomments.subcomment: I agree.  Where does the electric come from?  Fossil fuel.  Can the electric infrastructure withstand the added demand for power?  What happens to the batteries/cars after the lifespan finishes?  I'm not a believer.  Maybe if they put solar panels in the car it could be something eco...
subsubcomments: Solar panels on the roof of your home will also get the job done. But once again, all valid points!

subcomments.subcomment: it’s an interesting discussion. Electricity in TH is not very clean unless you’re making it yourself.
subsubcomments: Exactly
Despite that I think most of us will be driving EVs in 10 years. It’s a thing. Like I said, interesting.
That is also my vision. Many cities facing pollution issues are advocating for EVs. While there is certainly a challenge in producing clean energy, we must start somewhere...

Im sceptical about whether most of us will be driving Ev's in 10 years, not just in Thailand but globally even. I know that most governments have mandated the halt of production of ICE vehicles within the next 10 year, but the reality is that most countries dont have the capacity to produce enough electricity for us all to be driving EV's and I am not convinced that situation will be vastly different in 10 yeas time. Thats before we even get into the discussion of lithium mining and the slave/chid labour that is used to mine it. Currently, there is  not 1 single lithium battery manufacturer that can guarantee that slave/child labour was not used in the mining of the lithium for it batteries.

Yes, I understand. But some governments are just itching to mandate us all into driving EVs. In California the State has reportedly mandated only EV purchases by 2035. Yet their electric grid is dirty, unreliable, and causes wild fires. I see the government here is just itching to do the same thing even though it makes little sense. Import taxes on EVs and Hybrids are way lower than on ICUs. You can buy a Tesla here now for 1.7 million baht. Two years ago they were over 4 million if I remember correctly. Thailand's government can do a lot to improve the use of solar at home by offering tax incentives and cheaper imports of materials, but they seem to really love the idea of EVs and I get worried they will be forced on us. For families who have two or more cars, one small EV to get around town, an electric shopping car, especially here in Phuket, is a nice way to go for sure, especially if you can charge it at home (three phase power is needed for a good charge.) But this is a luxury thing and not practical for most Thai families.

comments.comment: Someone wants do positive impact for environment use bicycle )
￼ More importantly, electric bikes illegal to use on Thai roads as highlighted by the Thai government less than six months ago .

subcomments.subcomment: , the post is about motorbikes (scooters), not about bicycles. Electric motorbikes are not illegal to use in Thailand and can be registered.

comments.comment: Eco friendly cars, with batteries supplied by child slaves, and charged up coal power stations

subcomments.subcomment: Hi Alan, I also read Amnesty International's report on children working in the copper and cobalt mines in Congo. This is undoubtedly a terrible situation, and we must do everything we can to prevent it. However, I don't believe we should halt the electrification of our fleet. After all, we didn't stop wearing clothes when we learned that children were involved in their production in Bangladesh, did we? Most major textile producers have taken steps to address and prevent child labor, and I'm confident that similar measures will be implemented in the car and motorbike industry as well.

comments.comment: Hey Nick. Good luck with the business which I fully support. I’m completely sold on an electric motorbike and that’ll be my next purchase later this year. Whilst looking at what’s available it seems there is a limit on the top speed, below that which most would want. I know people like to rent motorbikes and go on trips to Krabi etc. The limited range of an electric motorbike makes that impractical for any distance. Electric motorbikes have a range of 50-120km between charges and then a 3 or 4 hour charging time. That’s not appealing to someone who wants to go any distance to have to stop every hour or 2 to charge the battery for 3 hours or more. Finally, many people I’ve mentioned electric motorbikes to have the perception that they’re less reliable than their gasoline equivalents. When you actually look into it, the reverse it true, electric being more reliable due to less moving parts and less heat.  Having said all that, a top speed limited to 80km/h and a range of 120km is perfect for my needs pottering around the island doing 10 to 20k per day. Hence why I’ll be going for it very soon. Hope this helps. Good luck again.

subcomments.subcomment: Hi Paul, thank you for your positive feedback! If you'd like to learn more about what's available and explore the pros and cons of different brands and models, please don't hesitate to reach out.Also, stay tuned for the larger bikes. They're already available in many countries, so I'm confident they'll arrive in Thailand soon. Another commenter mentioned the Harley Davidson Livewire, for example, which looks like an amazing bike.

comments.comment: Majority of bikes are scooters.   About 100thb to fill the tank for about 120kms.   Not a huge incentive to change unless scooter is much cheaper and owner has easy access to home power recharging.

subcomments.subcomment: Thank you, Wayne, for your contribution. I wouldn't say that a scooter is necessarily cheaper, but rather that the costs are similar to those of a petrol bike, as mentioned in earlier comments. This means that for the same price, you can ride a bike that is more environmentally friendly, quieter (which is a significant personal advantage for me), and boasts great design. Of course, design preferences are subjective, but we've received a lot of 'wow' reactions when people see the bike for the first time.

comments.comment: Service for ANY brands here outside of mitsubishi, toyota, and izuzu is horrendous. Who is gonna work on my tesla when it breaks? seriously. Look up google reviews of every major automobile manufacturer here...

comments.comment: You need to sort out the legality of these vehicles and how the power affects this. You will need to advise on insurance what kind of licence..  Thai  or IDP.You should also be wearing crash hats in your promo!

subcomments.subcomment: Hi Will, There is no difference between a 'traditional' combustion bike and an electric motorbike when it comes to legality. Thai law treats both bikes exactly the same.
subsubcomments: Thailand, 500 watts is the legal power output before registration & insurance is required.
For renters one assumes then that a FULL m/c D?L is required accompanied by an IDP?What insurance do you provide?
The registration works exactly similar to let’s say buying a Honda Click or Yamaha Filano. We provide a health insurance for all of our customers.

"a health insurance" - are you referring to the compulsory insurance that is purchased along with the road tax or do you include further insurance - I take it any damage to the bike is not covered or third party property damage?

Hi Will, like every other motorbike rental and/or lease company in Phuket, we provide compulsory medical insurance. Insuring the motorbikes against damage doesn't make sense due to the bike's relatively low value compared to the insurance premium, and body parts for electric bikes are relatively affordable. Our policy aligns with what traditional bike rentals offer, with the only distinction being that our motorbikes are electric rather than combustion-powered.

subcomments.subcomment: And of course, we strongly encourage every customer to wear a helmet! The people in our promo are depicted as standing still.
subsubcomments: :"strongly encourage" it is required by law in Thailand and I believe in Phuket they are considering prosecuting renters who rent out machines without helmets?

Many tourists take out holiday insurance from home - however these often exclude the rental of motorcycles - some permit it but put an engine size limit on the machines of 125cc. How will these electric M/Cs be classed - for instance a Honda Click can be 125 or 150 cc which is the "classification" for your electric bikes?
Hi Will, all of our bikes come with two safety helmets. When we say 'encourage,' we mean that while we provide helmets, we can't ensure if everyone wears them.

comments.comment: I bought already second ORA for the past year, range 500 km, price 1 300 mln baht. There is application- plug share, where you can find charge stations. The problem is - if you don’t have thai id - it is very difficult to register on some charging stations. Even GWM could not help me with this. Very often the owners of not electric cars leave their cars on parking places with wall chargers, especially in hotels - security doesn’t control this. They just don’t understand the problem,Now when i travel “behind the bridge” - i choose hotels with charging stations- but always have a lot of problems with security, trying to find the owners of cars, which are already full charged for example. Whats the price of electric bikes for sale and for rent? We have channel for our clients - you can give us your advert. We can suggest it to our clients.https://t.me/voprit_rus

# **Foundation in The Path to Enlightenment - Meditation Practitioner Course (30-hours)
(3-7 July 2023)**

This course focuses on guiding Students in developing a solid foundation in The Teachings and practices of Gotama Buddha.

Students will learn how to establish a “life practice” based on independent observation of Gotama Buddha’s Teachings. Students will be guided in how to acquire wisdom through learning and practicing The Teachings to liberate the mind on The Path to attaining Enlightenment.

At the conclusion of this course, Students will have a theoretical foundation to start integrating and applying these Teachings in daily life to include a consistent meditation practice to eliminate discontent feelings from the mind such as sadness, anger, frustration, irritation, annoyance, guilt, shame, fears, boredom, loneliness, shyness, jealousy, resentment, stress, anxiety, etc.

**Teachings & Discussions (Dhamma Talks)**

- Life Story of Gotama Buddha

- Enlightenment: What is “Enlightenment”?

- The Four Noble Truths: Establishing Right View

- The Eight Fold Path: The Path for All Humans to Enlightenment

- Transforming The Three Poisons: Craving, Anger, and Ignorance

- The Five Precepts: A Householder's Guide to Daily Practice

- What is Kamma and How Does It Affect Me?

- What is Merit?

- Meditation: Developing Your Practice

- Buddhist Temple Tour

**Meditation Practice**

- Meditation Instruction: Breathing Mindfulness Meditation

- Meditation Positions: Seated, Lying, Standing, and Walking Position

- Buddhist Chanting in Pali

(There are no prerequisites for this course. Offered openly and freely to “all beings” at no cost.)

**Learn More:** [https://www.buddhadailywisdom.com/courses-retreats-in-chiang-mai-thai](https://www.buddhadailywisdom.com/courses-retreats-in-chiang-mai-thai?fbclid=IwAR3ECulQ0Or9tW78cGJ2o_W-0Y4HlS3d_8YaJGg6tB-9yHIhZZVutWa1xNU)

——-

**Daily Wisdom - Walking The Path with The Buddha**

Dedicated to the education of Gotama Buddha's Teachings to attain Enlightenment.

[https://www.BuddhaDailyWisdom.com](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.BuddhaDailyWisdom.com%2F%3Ffbclid%3DIwAR2tuVsb7tYHxMXZXq4w6T73Q5vD0pfSkQMfANyfAJYoRmGQaKxuOocAVqU&h=AT3yDVA6va8h22i3BojmHKS8ixjLGgf6VVFs5tw2wo-J-kqWmutI68uH0EW6lcip3DtMmRn_Fk_A6yCSDU-I45Gh01Um9Eg5JXSZj-Iw1uI51i30h4CTBSZtM9mnNd9gTy3xl7O8GQ&__tn__=-UK-R&c[0]=AT1-xwjmsu_BqJN1DJUjqnjSAG-SQVJJzLZKd1eK-zBSTiwxbflKsHRKC2hAoF56yTC10K1K_n2dQm_tcHZE5VCn5fHR4OzjkHfA_vQpGEjPmcQUqgeKhCeULuvMTGzuPieQ2A3LWzvfiXn1sQ8Yy4AntDCoc3qhBsE9dpop5LFHHF2vtvUDB8oTtO1XmdmmIhIaDjClB0OD325Rr4qJ4w)

(See our website for online learning, courses, and retreats.)

----------

**David Roylance** is a dedicated Practitioner and Teacher of Gotama Buddha’s Teachings who has been part of the Thai community since 2001. He visited Thailand for the first time in 2002 and brought the Traditional Thai Healing Arts back to the United States of America to share with people in the Western World.

His Traditional Thai Healing Arts centers, located in the Washington DC area, provided traditional Thai healing arts to clients and educational opportunities to Students to explore the Thai healing arts, Thai culture, and The Teachings of Gotama Buddha. David is a published author with books on the topics of Traditional Thai Healing Arts and The Path That Leads to Enlightenment.

David has taught Gotama Buddha’s Teachings since 2005 in the United States of America. In 2015, he closed his businesses and relocated to Chiang Mai, Thailand to be closer to the Thai culture and the Thai Community of Buddhist Practitioners.

David shares Gotama Buddha’s Teachings with Household Practitioners and Ordained Practitioners in Chiang Mai, Thailand and around the world through courses, retreats, and special events providing guidance to help people attain Enlightenment - a peaceful, calm, serene, and content mind with joy.

Check out our group sound healing offerings that are a part of our regular weekly schedule🌟

MONDAY'S at 6:30 PM to 7:30 PM
Moksha Sound Bath w/ Mantra Meditation
An active meditation with chanting followed by a sound bath where you lay down and close your eyes.

WEDNESDAY'S at 11:00 AM to 12:00 PM
Moksha Sound Bath Journey
A relaxing experience where you lay down, close your eyes and let the waves of wellbeing wash over you.

# **You Are Invited to Learn, Grow, and Evolve**

I am delighted to share this post to provide an update that will help you understand upcoming learning opportunities that will support you in your journey on The Path to Enlightenment.

----------
# **International Meditation & Buddhist Study Retreat
(Chiang Mai, Thailand)**

You are invited to participate and learn at this upcoming retreat hosted in Chiang Mai, Thailand at Wat Tung Yu, a Theravada Buddhist Temple. From 20-25 August 2023, there will be an opportunity for you to come together with our international Community of Practitioners and Teachers.

This retreat will provide you the opportunity to more deeply learn and practice The Teachings of The Buddha while connecting with our international Community of Practitioners and Teachers. You will have the opportunity to visit the largest population of people who are practicing The Teachings of The Buddha - The Kingdom of Thailand, while having the opportunity to meet members of this international Community.

Not only will you have the opportunity to learn these Teachings and meet members of this international Community of Practitioners and Teachers but, you will be surrounded by millions of Buddhist Practitioners for you to be able to observe how a society of Buddhist Practitioners function on a daily basis.

This will excellerate and deeply enhance your understanding and practice of these Teachings.

Your understanding and practice of these Teachings will be significantly improved by visiting "the source" of these Teachings located in Chiang Mai, Thailand - The International Headquarters of Buddhist Teachings.

David Roylance will provide Teachings during this retreat in Thailand at no cost. This retreat is offered openly and freely to "all beings".

You can find all the details using this link. Perhaps I will see you in Thailand.

**Learn more:** [https://www.buddhadailywisdom.com/2023-retreat-cm](https://www.buddhadailywisdom.com/2023-retreat-cm?fbclid=IwAR112PcEfZ5iSXxVypN2nZa43O1dKLgMGzbiHZwJ3s7HhY5OxEDIn-ugitc)

# **Foundation in The Path to Enlightenment - Meditation Practitioner Course (30-hours) 
(5-9 June 2023)**

This course focuses on guiding Students in developing a solid foundation in The Teachings and practices of Gotama Buddha.

Students will learn how to establish a “life practice” based on independent observation of Gotama Buddha’s Teachings. Students will be guided in how to acquire wisdom through learning and practicing The Teachings to liberate the mind on The Path to attaining Enlightenment.

At the conclusion of this course, Students will have a theoretical foundation to start integrating and applying these Teachings in daily life to include a consistent meditation practice to eliminate discontent feelings from the mind such as sadness, anger, frustration, irritation, annoyance, guilt, shame, fears, boredom, loneliness, shyness, jealousy, resentment, stress, anxiety, etc.

**Teachings & Discussions (Dhamma Talks)**

- Life Story of Gotama Buddha

- Enlightenment: What is “Enlightenment”?

- The Four Noble Truths: Establishing Right View

- The Eight Fold Path: The Path for All Humans to Enlightenment

- Transforming The Three Poisons: Craving, Anger, and Ignorance

- The Five Precepts: A Householder's Guide to Daily Practice

- What is Kamma and How Does It Affect Me?

- What is Merit?

- Meditation: Developing Your Practice

- Buddhist Temple Tour

**Meditation Practice**

- Meditation Instruction: Breathing Mindfulness Meditation

- Meditation Positions: Seated, Lying, Standing, and Walking Position

- Buddhist Chanting in Pali

(There are no prerequisites for this course. Offered openly and freely to “all beings” at no cost.)

**Learn More:** https://www.buddhadailywisdom.com/courses-retreats-in-chiang-mai-thai

——-

**Daily Wisdom - Walking The Path with The Buddha**

Dedicated to the education of Gotama Buddha's Teachings to attain Enlightenment.

https://www.BuddhaDailyWisdom.com

(See our website for online learning, courses, and retreats.)

----------

**David Roylance** is a dedicated Practitioner and Teacher of Gotama Buddha’s Teachings who has been part of the Thai community since 2001. He visited Thailand for the first time in 2002 and brought the Traditional Thai Healing Arts back to the United States of America to share with people in the Western World.

His Traditional Thai Healing Arts centers, located in the Washington DC area, provided traditional Thai healing arts to clients and educational opportunities to Students to explore the Thai healing arts, Thai culture, and The Teachings of Gotama Buddha. David is a published author with books on the topics of Traditional Thai Healing Arts and The Path That Leads to Enlightenment.

David has taught Gotama Buddha’s Teachings since 2005 in the United States of America. In 2015, he closed his businesses and relocated to Chiang Mai, Thailand to be closer to the Thai culture and the Thai Community of Buddhist Practitioners.

David shares Gotama Buddha’s Teachings with Household Practitioners and Ordained Practitioners in Chiang Mai, Thailand and around the world through courses, retreats, and special events providing guidance to help people attain Enlightenment - a peaceful, calm, serene, and content mind with joy.
